dfn: The gut, the internal organs of the lower torso, the seat of the unconscious mind.
To hate something that is disgusting.
To dwell restfully and peacefully.
The dwelling place of man (home), god (mountain) or animal (pasture or stable).
As a wink of time.
An ample quantity of number (many) or plentiful supply of strength (great).
Great plenty or supply of numbers (many) or strength (great). One who is abundant in authority such as a master or teacher. Also, an archer as one abundant with arrows.
A thorny tree commonly found in the Near East. In its plural form can mean wood or boards from the tree.
To receive from the messenger what is given as a message.
To gather or pile up, especially little by little.
What is accumulated in the sense of gathering to build a nest. What is obtained as one's own. Often used in the context of purchasing.
In the sense of drawing something out.
Something gained by purchase or exchange.
To declare one innocent of a crime or oath.
To augment something by increasing it in amount or supply. The hiphil (causative) form means "again."
A species of viper, possibly an adder.
To join or stick to someone or something.
The collective members from the tribe of Levi who administrate over the tent of meeting or the temple.

One who manages the affairs and activities of an organization. The administrators (often translated as "priest") of Israel are Levites who manage the Tent of Meeting, and later the Temple, as well as teach the people the teachings and directions of YHWH, and perform other duties, such as the inspection of people and structures for disease.
To praise or to be boastful.
To put on special ornaments or garments for a special office or event. (see Isaiah 61:10).
To bring or move forward; to raise to a higher rank; to make progress.
A moderate feeling or emotion. A tender attachment or fondness.
To oppress severely so as to cause persistent suffering or anguish in the sense of making dark.
The cause of persistent suffering, pain or distress.
A time to come beyond another event.
What spreads out by itself rather than sown.
Probably the Agate, a variety of quartz that may be gray, light blue, orange, red or black in color. The Septuagint uses achates meaning Agate.
The part of existence extending from the beginning to any given time; a period of time marked by a central figure or prominent feature.
A word of uncertain meaning.
An object of terror that causes trembling.
A state of being in emotional or physical turmoil or pain.
Two parties to be in concert or concurrence.
The whole of a group.
On all sides; enclose so as to surround; in rotation or succession. A circling or bordering about the edge.
To be a part of.
The nut or the tree. From the nut’s shape like an open eye.
The glistening oils of the plant. The oils or the tree.
To stand with, or next to, someone or something.
In addition to. The idea of a gathering of objects or ideas.
The place of sacrifice.
A fossil gum resin.
A laying down in wait.
To lay in wait of another to capture or do harm or injury.
Probably the Amethyst, a violet form of quartz. The Septuagint uses Amethystos.
To expand, multiply or increase.
The act of disturbing or irritating. Something that is light in stature; considered worthless as compared with something of much greater value or importance.
An unknown type of bird, possibly from its nose or beak.
Something written or spoken in reply to a question.
An indeterminate amount or thing.
At a little distance; away from in space or time; holding different opinions.
Something that clothes or adorns. As forming to the image of the body.
What is seen or is in sight.
To arrange, fix or set in place, to determine a set place or time to meet.
A person, place, thing or time that is fixed or officially set.
A fixed or officially set event, occasion or date.
To come near or nearer to.
A curved object. The bowing of the back as when digging. Also any high arched or convex thing such as the eyebrow or the rim of a wheel.
An indefinite region or expanse; a particular part of a surface or body. A place.
The human upper limb as representing power.
An insignia or emblem showing loyalty or ownership.
To grab weapons in preparation for battle.
The arms and equipment of a soldier or military unit. From a root meaning "heavy" and often paralleled with other weapons. Figurative for power.
An ornament worn on the ankle or wrist that jingles when walking.
A large organized group mustered together and armed for war or service.
A distinctive pervasive and usually pleasant or savory smell or odor.
A spice that is pleasing to the nose.
To set something in order or into a correct or suitable configuration, sequence or adjustment.
Set in a row or in order according to rank or age. In parallel. Arranged items in juxtaposition.
To arrive at a destination.
A missile weapon shot from a bow having a pointed head, slender shaft and feathers as a butt.
A place of straight or stepped incline.
The solid residue left when material is thoroughly burned.
A large group, as a gathering of the flock of sheep to the shepherd.
To divide and mete out according to a plan among the appropriate recipients.
A relationship between two persons, places or objects that connects them together.
In the sense of overfilled.
A function word to indicate presence or occurrence, a goal of an implied or indicated action, etc. Commonly used as a grammatical tool to identify the direct object of a verb.
A specified moment or time.
To indicate a specific moment or place in time.
An act of paying the price to release the debt or person. A covering over of transgression.
To bring one's self into an association with another. To have an attachment to another.
To be antagonistic or unfriendly to another. An action taken by an enemy.
The sister of one's father or mother. One who is loved.
To take vengeance for or on behalf of another; to gain satisfaction for a wrong by punishing the wrongdoer; to pursue and kill one who has murdered.
To bring sleep to an end; to not be in a state of sleeping.
As shaking when in the presence of an awesome sight.
A sharp pointed tool for piercing holes in leather or the skin.
An unknown bird of prey.
The part of the body that is behind. To be in the rear of or behind something.
The nape between the shoulders and the head.
With the back foremost; in a reverse or contrary way; i.e. To walk backward in the sense of being after oneself.
To cook using dry heat, especially in an oven.
What is baked.
A pair of scales used for weighing. From the ear as the place where balance is determined.
A lack of hair on the front part of the head.
The top of the head void of any hair.
An aromatic preparation for a healing ointment. A salve rubbed and pressed into the skin.
A sweet smelling spices.
A gathering of men for attacking or raiding.
To gather or assemble as a group for attacking or raiding.
The banks of a river as a channel for the water.
An elaborate meal often accompanied by a ceremony.
The bent bar of the yoke that goes around the neck, also a branch that is used as pole. A slipping or wavering of the foot.
The desert as a place of serpents.
Of a dog.
A grain, identified by its hairs, used as food, and for determining the month of Aviv.
Incapable of bearing children. Childless in the sense of being naked of children.
Action or thought that is vain or for an improper purpose.
To exchange an item or service for another.
The bottom or foundation which provides support. A person's home or family as being a base. A species of gnat.
To cleanse by being immersed in, or washing with, water.
In the sense of fat. An engine of war for battering down walls.
A struggle between two armies.
To exist or have breath. That which exists has breath. In Hebrew thought the breath is the character of someone or something. Just as a man has character, so do objects.
A woman who practices promiscuous sexual behavior, especially for hire.
To successfully prevail, overcome or endure.
To be strong in might or numbers. From the abundant number of bones in the body.
An object that is in the form of an almond.
To be overwhelmed with surprise or sudden wonder; astonished greatly.
To have a relationship with another through marriage.
A strong feeling of displeasure and belligerence aroused by a wrong.
Feeling shame, guilt or disgrace; to be dried up with shame.
Having a harsh, disagreeably acrid taste. One of the four basic taste sensations.
To be fearless and daring; courageous.
To be without children through miscarriage, barrenness or loss of children.
Free from dirt, pollution or immorality; unadulterated, pure.
The doing of a thing slyly or cunningly.
One of the four basic taste sensations
To be clearly distinguished. To have a marked difference. To be prominent; separated out completely.
To have two identical pieces placed together. Also to bear twins as doubles.
To be filled with intoxicating drink.
Impaired or abnormal filling of purpose; to act wrongly by injuring or doing an evil action.
To be large in size or stature.
To face another. The hiphil (causative) form means "tell" in the sense of speaking face to face.
To be distant, a long way off.
To be polluted or dirty. Usually in the sense of immorality.
Abundantly productive.
To commit an offense, especially consciously.
To be difficult; not easily penetrated; not easily yielding to pressure.
To be great in weight, wealth or importance. The piel (intensive) form means "honor."
To lift up to a greater elevation or stature.
To have an urgent craving for food; famished.
Exhausted in strength, endurance, vigor or freshness.
A state of suffering and want due to poverty or affliction.
To shake out.
To be fewer or diminished in size or amount.
To be brought down low in poverty.
Devoid of sensation or emotion.
To be of an advanced age.
To be hidden or obscured from vision; to be beyond the horizon; to be covered or unknown.
To be sunk down into a dark depth.
To be ruddy. To have a dark reddish color.
To be wealthy.
To be in a state of depression.
To be filled full or to overflowing; to have a complete amount.
To be twisted through pain.
To come to a standstill in speech or deed. To be quiet; refrain from speech or action.
To be able to decide or discern between good and bad, right and wrong; to act correctly in thought and action.
To have little size or slight dimensions; insignificant.
To be soft.
To be fermented by adding leaven to bread. Also, sour in taste, thought or action.
Any four sided object. Also, to go down on the hands and knees, to be on all fours.
To walk on the right path without losing the way.
To be in a direct or correct line, path or thought.
To be separated out from others; to be scattered abroad.
To be mentally astute, firm, obstinate or courageous. Having or marked by great physical, moral or intellectual power.
To turn away from the correct path toward another direction.
To be thick. Thick.
Being three times as great or as many.
To be uncircumcised.
Physically or morally impure; dirty, filthy.
To glow; project extreme heat. To be heated, either internally or externally, such as from the sun or a fire.
To be free of wound or injury, defect or impairment, disease or deformity; physically and mentally sound.
To be filled with eagerness and ardent interest in pursuit of something.
To be born or bear the first fruits.
The hair that grows on a man's face. A long beard as a sign of old age and wisdom. An elder as a bearded one.
An animal as distinguished from man or a plant. A tall or large creature. Also representative of wealth, as one who is exalted.
To strike repeatedly in a rhythm such as a drum.
To crush or beat something into thin or small pieces.
To strike something with a sharp blow.
Grain that is crushed to make meal.
To be shaped into a specific form by an outside force such as a hammer.
Generally pleasing. Possessing the qualities of loveliness or functionality.
The qualities in a person or thing that give pleasure to the senses. Someone or something that is desired, approved, favored or in agreement by another.
A place for sleeping. Spread out sheet for sleeping.
A colony of ordered insects.
What precedes another event.
To sever the neck from the body. Also, to break the neck.
The whole of a person, god or creature including the body, mind, emotion, character and inner parts.
To regard or portray as less impressive or important; to be light in weight; to curse or despise in the sense of making light.
An instrument used to call to attention or to a warning. From its rhythmic ringing.
The undersurface of an animal; the stomach and other digestive organs.
To acquire ownership or authority over, something or someone owned by another.
One who is cherished by another.
To pay homage to another one by bowing low or getting on the knees with the face to the ground.
A kneeling down as a sign of respect to another.
Below; in a lower place, position or state. As under a stretched out sheet.
To be of use, service or profit in order that one may benefit from it.
A dry weight measure equal to one-half shekel weight.
Being next to something.
Excelling all others; most, largest; most productive or good, utility or satisfaction.
A promise or contract of impending marriage. To request a woman for marriage.
In the time, space or interval that separates.
To make secure by tying; to confine, restrain or restrict as if with bonds. bind with a cord.
To tie something. The tying of the tongue, silence.
Attached around something.
A creature distinguished by a body covering of feathers and wings as forelimbs.
A carnivorous bird that feeds on carrion or meat taken by hunting.
What is brought forth from the womb.
What is given birth to; a baby human or animal that is brought from the womb into the open world.
The act or process of bringing forth offspring from the womb. Total of the children born within an era.
Rights, privileges or possessions to which a person is entitled by birth. The rights of the firstborn son (see Deut. 21:17). Also meaning the firstborn.
To seize especially with teeth or jaws; to sting, wound or pierce as with a fang. To give usury in the sense of a biting.
A difficult taste or experience.
Having a harsh, disagreeably acrid taste; to be rebellious or disobedient.
Edible plants, that when eaten brings tears to the eyes.
Having a harsh, disagreeably acrid taste.
As darkened from the heat of a fire.
To blow heavily.
A strong devastating wind.
To burn, flash or shine brightly. Also used for the magic of magicians.
A darkness of the eye.
To become dark of site through blindness or the putting out of the eyes.
The red fluid that circulates through the body.
The flower of a plant, especially of one producing an edible fruit.
To expel air from the mouth.
To scatter something by blowing.
A color that is created with the use of a dye.
A plank of wood often used to wall off an area or restrict access.
To cover as a ceiling or to hide.
By extension, the physical form, either alive or dead; a corpse.
To generate bubbles of vapor when heated; to cook a meat in water. The hiphil (causative) form means "ripen."
Meat or other edible that is cooked in water over a fire.
A festering under the skin. Pits in the skin from disease.
Knowing one's position or authority and standing in it. Strengthened and protected from danger.
A female slave. One who is bound to another.
The hard tissue of which the skeleton is chiefly composed. As a numerous amount.
A piece of cloth that is wound around the head as a decoration.
A temporary shelter; a small enclosure; dwelling place.
As tongs for taking food. What is taken
The outer edge of a region. Also the area within the borders.
To form by making something hollow.
To pierce with a sharp object.
Brought forth, as if by birth.
The human chest, especially the front side.
A supporting and level base of a building or structure which lies on or in the ground.
A large rock used as a weapon or a rock cliff used as a place of defense. Also flint, a very hard rock that when fractured forms a razor sharp edge and used for knives, spears or arrowheads.
To be defined by a border.
Stalks and ears of a cereal grass bound together. A sheaf of grain that is bound.
To be confined or hedged in together; to wait or to be held back in the sense of being bound up.
Marks the outer edge, the end, of a definite area or region. Idiomatically used for an entire region.
A weapon made from a stiff branch to shoots arrows. A bow-shaped object such as a rainbow.
To lower the head as a sign of respect.
The large intestines as encompassed about by the torso. Compassion as coming from the bowels.
A concave vessel especially for holding liquids. As with high sides.
A rigid rectangular receptacle often with a cover. Any box-shaped object.
A male child from birth to puberty.
An ornamental band or chain worn around the wrist. As the ends joined together.
To twist, entwine or weave several pieces together in parallel to become one.
Finely made articles of clothing made by weaving together fibers.
A rough, prickly vine or shrub. Thorn.
A branch used as a staff. Also, a tribe as a branch of the family.
From its shine.
An act of defending one's property, convictions or beliefs. Control through physical strength.
From the strength of the bones.
A broken, ruptured or torn condition or area; a gap as in a wall made by battering.
Baked and leavened bread primarily made of flour or meal. Also food in general.
Cakes baked on hot stones.
Meaning dubious.
To throw something on the ground and break it by trampling.
To demolish an elevated object; to tear down.
To be spread out wide or widespread.
Milk-producing glandular organs situated on the chest in the female; the fore part of the body between the neck and the abdomen. Also a goat-idol from the teats of the goat.
An ornamental plate worn by the High Priest that held stones representing the twelve tribes of Israel and the Urim and Thummim.
Air inhaled or exhaled. The breath of man or god. The essence of life.
To relax and breath in deeply to refresh oneself. To take a breather.
To buy a favor or service that would be otherwise out of reach.
A building material typically rectangular and of moist clay hardened by heat.
A payment given by or in behalf of a prospective husband to the bride's family.
A radiating or reflective light. As cheerful.
Harmonized and in balance. Cheerful.
A rock of sulfur that burns.
To issue out; to bring forth children, either by the woman who bears them or the man who fathers them. The piel (intensive) form means "act-as-midwife."
Something that is broken into pieces.
A male who has the same parents as another or shares one parent with another. One who stands between the enemy and the family, a protector.

The large males of a flock of sheep or heard of deer. By extension, anything of strength including a chief, pillar (as the strong support of a building), or oak tree (one of the strongest of the woods).
Dangles from a rope to draw water and lifted out of the well.
The beginning of a flower that bursts from the plant.
To sprout flowers or blooms. To come into a fullness.
To construct a building or home with wood, stone or other material or a family with sons.
To raise the elevation of the bank of a river or a highway. To raise one up higher than others.
A large male un-castrated bovine.
A young bull. Also, insinuating strength.
A reed that grows in, or on the edge of, a pond or river.
A group of men or things bound together.
The heavy load carried in bondage.
The place of interment or deposit of a deceased body.
To undergo rapid combustion or consume fuel in such a way as to give off heat, gases, and, usually, light; be on fire.
To char wood in a fire. A passion that burns for another.
To light a sacrifice or aromatic plant on fire creating smoke, often aromatic.
Something that is aflame with fire.
To be larger, fuller, or more crowded; to break out or break forth as a blooming flower or the wings of a bird.
A sudden and forceful release or issuing out.
To dispose of by depositing in the ground.
The principal occupation of one's life. A service.
On the contrary. An outcome desired in the sense of joining.
One who slaughters animals or dresses their flesh.
As the place of sitting.
A support or prop. Wall or abutment built to support another wall on the outside, when very high or loaded with a heavy structure.
In proximity to. The sense of standing with another.
A cake of pressed figs.
A pile of rubble from a fire or other calamity.
To determine by mathematical deduction or practical judgment; to comprehend and carefully consider a path or course of action.
To raise one's voice or speak loudly and with urgency; to give, a name; to meet in the sense of being called to a meeting; to have an encounter by chance; to read in the sense of calling out words.
Either of two ruminant mammals used as draft animals in the desert. The produce of the fields were tied in large bundles and transported on camels.
To erect temporary shelters (as tents) together; to stop for the night and pitch the tents.
A place suitable for or used as the location of a camp. The inhabitants of a camp.
The covering of a temporary shelter.
A military leader; the commander of a unit or a body of troops. The leader of a family, tribe or people as one who carries the burdens of the people.
A person who is enslaved or dominated.
The state or period of being held, imprisoned, enslaved, or confined.
The act of catching, winning, or gaining control by force, stratagem, or guile; to take one away from his homeland as an involuntary prisoner.
A traveling company that follows a prescribed path.
Probably the Carnelian, a reddish brown gemstone. The Hebrew word is from a root meaning red or reddish. Another possible translation is Jasper.
To transfer from one place to another; to transport as by vehicle.
A heavy, two-wheeled vehicle, animal-drawn, used for transporting freight or for farming.
Translucent elastic tissue that lines the joints of the bony skeleton.
The tree, wood or spice which is used in anointing oils and perfumes.
To ruin or break into pieces by throwing or pulling down.
A molten metal that is poured in a cast to form images.
To remove with force and intention.
To drive out, expel, thrust away.
The clouding color of the eyes that appear as a mixture.
Domesticated bovine animals. Strong beasts used to break the soil with plows.
A large kettle or boiler, of copper or other metal. A smelting pot.
A natural underground chamber or series of chambers that open to the surface. A hole in the rock.
To come to an end; to die out; to stop an activity for the purpose of rest or celebration.
A stopping of work or activity; An activity curtailed before completion. The seventh day of the week (often translated as Sabbath) when all business ceases for rest and celebration.
A coniferous tree from the cyprus family having wide, spreading branches. The wood or tree or something made it.
The middle of something.
Relating to grain or plants that produce it. A plentiful crop.
A strand of linked metal loops.
A bedroom; a natural or artificial enclosed space or cavity. Place surrounded by walls. An inner place as hidden or secret.
To make different in some particular; to make radically different; exchange one thing for another. To repeat in the sense of a second time.
A person or thing committed to the care of another. What is given to be watched over and protected.
A light, two-wheeled battle vehicle for one or two persons, usually drawn by two horses and driven from a standing position.
A food consisting of the coagulated, compressed and usually ripened curd of milk separated from the whey.
One who is loved.
The breast containing heart. What is prominently visible. The breast of an animal used for a sacrifice.
Probably the chestnut tree but uncertain.
A young bird that has burst out of the egg.
Accorded highest rank or office; of greatest importance, significance, or influence. The military commander of a thousand men. One who is yoked to another to lead and teach.
A young person, especially between infancy and youth.
A word of Egyptian origins.
The offspring of the parent or descendents of a patron. More than one child.
A vertical structure in a building and enclosing a flue or flues that carry off smoke. A hole in the roof where smoke escapes.
Having qualities that appeal to a cultivated taste. As plucked from the tree or vine.
The best of the vine, the best grapes.
To select freely and after consideration.
One who is the object of choice or of divine favor.
A spice from the bark of a small evergreen tree. The essential oil is of great price.
A going around in a circle. To return to a starting point in the sense of going full circle.
The removal of the front part of the male sexual organ.
An artificial reservoir for storing water. A hole or well as dug out.
An inhabited place of greater size, population, or importance than a town or village. Usually protected by a wall.
A word of Egyptian origins.
A group of persons of common ancestry. A group of people joined together by certain convictions or common affiliation.
The act of being free from dirt or immorality. Free from foreign elements.
To split in two as the hoofs of a clean animal.
To divide by or as if by a cutting blow; to separate into distinct parts; to break, cut or divide something in half.
A high rock, cliff or towering rock, as a place of defense.
To grab hold of someone or something that is secure and safe.
A loose outer garment worn over other clothes both by men and women.
To draw together to close or shut.
Garments in general.
A visible mass of particles of water or ice in the form of fog, mist, or haze suspended usually at a considerable height in the air.
A number of similar things growing together or of things or persons collected or grouped closely together. A cluster of grapes from the vine or flowers from the plant.
The dim light before the rising of the sun. As dark in color.
An outer garment varying in length and style; the external growth on an animal.
A place of residence. An abode.
A condition of low temperature.
The hole in the middle of a rectangular garment for the head to pass through. An area reinforced around the neck opening.
To gather up straw, stubble or sticks.
An accumulation of objects or material. A collection of water (a pool, pond or sea) or horses (herd).
A young male horse; a young untried person. As dark in color.
To move toward something; approach; enter. This can be understood as to come or to go. The hiphil (causative) form means "bring."
To come close by or near to.
To cease. Conclude.
To rise up, as the sun does at the horizon.
Consolation in time of trouble or worry; to give solace in time of difficulty or sorrow. The niphal (passive) form means "repent."
To perform voluntary violation of the marriage bed.
A unified body of individuals; a group of people bound together.
One that accompanies another in the sense of a close companion or friend.
A group of persons or things for carrying on a project or undertaking; a group with a common testimony. May also mean a witness or testimony.
An illustration of similitude. Often a parable or proverb as a story of comparisons.
Being sympathetic, and understanding. A protecting from harm.
To drive or urge forcefully or irresistibly. A pressing into an action or narrow place.

Having all necessary parts, elements or steps. A state of being whole or full. Left unaltered and whole in its original functional state without removing or adding to it. To finish. A sacrifice or offering given to bring about peace.
Something that has been finished or made whole. A state of being complete.
The act or process of completing. This can be in a positive sense or negative, such as in a failure.
The combining of two or more ingredients to achieve the desired substance.
To hide to prevent discovery.
To become pregnant with young.
Regarding. Marked interest or regard usually arising through a personal tie or relationship. A turning over and bringing together of a thought.
To come to an end. The end of a time period or place or the end of something. The border of a country as its edges.
Cohabitation of persons not legally married; a woman living in a socially recognized state of being a mistress.
A special occasion as a temporary ceasing of normal activity.
Advice given in secret as a result of consultation.
Always used in a negative sense such as foolish confidence.
To cause trouble and confusion through a great noise such as with trumpets.
To bring to ruin; to make indistinct; to fail to differentiate from an often similar or related other. A barren place. Vanity as a state of waste.
To call or bring into existence.
To give approval; to be in concord in opinion or sentiment; agreement as to action or opinion; to be willing to go somewhere or do something.
Agreement or harmony of parts or features; showing steady conformity to character, profession, belief, or custom.
To pierce another with sharp words of reproach or scorn. (see Psalms 42:10). A nose ring is put in the piercing of the nose as a sign of betrothal (see Genesis 24:47).
To eat or drink; with the lips.
A disease making one thin.
An act or instance of striving or struggling against great difficulty or opposition.
Happening without interruption or cessation; continuous in time.
Maintain the action, to forge ahead with intention.
An opposition.
What is given or supplied in common with others.
To find or prove to be guilty.
Something baked.
A malleable, ductile, metallic element having a characteristic reddish-brown color. A precious metal.
Lifted up as a highly prized item.
A long slender flexible material made of several strands woven or twisted together. Made of twisted fibers.
A class of plants with seeds which are in the form of the size of a peppercorn. They are used medicinally and as a spice. Likened to the manna in its form and color.
The point where two lines meet.
The strongest point from where the rest of the structure is built from. As scraped out with a plane.
A dead body.
To make a preferred change in direction through instruction or chastisement.
An article of furniture for sitting or reclining.
Advice given in the sense of being the firm support of the community.
To find the total number of units. Also to give an account on record. The piel (intensive) form means "recount."
A group bound together.
To bind by joining or coupling together.
To bring together as a unit.
Having or characterized by mental or moral strength to venture, persevere, and withstand danger, fear or difficulty.
The grounds of a building or group of buildings. Villages outside of the larger cities, as "the yard of the city. " A courtyard as outside the house.
A solemn and binding agreement between two or more parties especially for the performance of some action. Often instituted through a sacrifice.
To afford protection or security; to hide from sight or knowledge; to cover over as with a lid.
To prevent disclosure or recognition of; to place out of sight; to completely cover over or hide.
Something that covers or conceals. A covering such as pitch or a monetary covering such as a bribe or ransom. A "village" as a covering.
The mature female of cattle.
To break open, apart or into pieces. The piel (intensive) form means "shatter."
One who engraves wood, stone or metal.
To break violently and noisily.
To have a strong or inward desire for something.
A great desire or longing.
A flowing body of water.
To reduce a dead body, or other object, to ashes by burning.
The act of burning a dead body to ashes.
A large creature that lives in the water (see Genesis 1:21) and the land (see Psalm 91:13).
What is closely watched for harvest time.
A level field for growing crops.
To pass from one side to the other; to go across a river or through a land; to transgress in the sense of crossing over.
A place or structure as on a street or over a river where pedestrians or vehicles pass from one side to the other. In the river for crossing.
An object showing Kingship or authority. Also, a sign upon the head as a sign of dedication.
In the sense of being rubbed. Meaning dubious.
To reduce to particles by pounding or grinding. Crush something to pieces. An oppression or struggle as crushing.
Pressed or squeezed with a force that destroys or deforms. Also a plague.
To utter loudly; to shout; to shed tears, often noisily. A loud crying or calling out.
To cry or call out loudly.
A hard vegetable.
The chewing of the cud by clean animals.
A vessel for holding liquids, usually for drinking.
The cup shape of the palm.
To change into curd; coagulate; congeal. To spoil; turn sour.
Immediate charge and control exercised by a person or authority. A careful watching over as an office, guard or prison.
A usage or practice common to many or to a particular place or class or habitual with an individual.
To penetrate with a sharp edged instrument.
To sever into two pieces or parts.
To discontinue or terminate. To sever the tip or end.
A sacrificial animal that has been cut into pieces.
To divide or slice with a sharp instrument such as a potsherd or iron blade. To make a decision in the sense of dividing between two choices. To be diligent in the sense of a sharp action.
To slap, strike or attack the rear.
An instrument that vibrates when shaken.
An unknown bird of prey.
To bring to ruin by destruction; to destroy through disfigurement or corruption.
To completely destroy with force. To tear or bring down.
Twisting, skipping, or leaping with joy. To rejoice in expression of thanksgiving for religious worship or festivity.
A circle of rejoicing.
Devoid or partially devoid of light; not receiving, reflecting, transmitting, producing or radiating light. As the darkness of a moonless night.
To be deprived of light. To be dark as night.
The state of being dark. As the darkness of a moonless night.
To shatter into pieces by force.
The tree that produces the date. An erect tree as a pillar.
A female having the relation of a child to parent. A village that resides outside of the city walls; as "the daughter of the city."
The wife of one’s son. Bride of the son, as brought into the camp, in the sense of making the man complete.
To begin to grow light as the sun rises in the east. The place of the rising sun.
The time of light between one dusk and the next one. Usually in the context of daylight hours but may also refer to the entire day or even a season.
The time of the day when the sun is shining.
An unknown bird of prey.
The remains of a dead creature or person.
To give as one's portion by a false impression.
A permanent cessation of all vital functions; the end of life.
The act or practice of not being honest.
To cause to accept as true or valid what is false or invalid. Can also mean usury in the sense of a deception. In the participle form can mean creditor in the sense of imposition.
To make a determination in a dispute or wrong doing.
A pronounced opinion.
To make a formal proclamation. Often used for the words of God.
A word of uncertain meaning.
To apply ornamentation to show distinguishment or distinction. To stand out; being seen in a good light. To boast, in the sense of decorating the self with words.
Ornamentation that shows position, distinguishment or distinction.
An adornment with designs used to decorate or tie an article of clothing.
To set something apart or apart from something for a special purpose.
Devoted to the worship of God.
Reserved for a specific use or purpose.
A work or action that is made.
The black of night or the pupil of the eye. In the sense of charring from a fire.
Extending far from some surface or area; in difficulty or distress. Deep and tumultuous water. A subterranean body of water.
Overcome or weakened by an outside force.
A word of uncertain meaning.
To be physically deformed in some manner which is usually covered.
To stop, detain or hinder for a time.
The quality or state of being luxurious. Flavorful meat.
A word of uncertain meaning.
To desire something out of pleasure or necessity; to have a high degree of gratification.
To set free; to take and hand over to or leave for another.
To hand over to another.
Meaning dubious.
To disclaim connection with or responsibility for. Withhold something from another or self as in a lie or submission.
To go astray from the correct path and become lost; to act against a law or teaching as one who has gone astray. The hiphil (causative) form means "convict."
Literally, to put a load on the shoulder to go away or leave early.
The act of making a gift or a free contribution. What is brought to another as a gift.
To place, especially for safekeeping or as a pledge; to be laid down; to sit down to rest or remain in place.
Valuables placed for safekeeping. Produce or other stores that are watched over.
What is of a concave shape such as a saddle or pasture in a valley. Also, may mean the sheep of the pasture.
The bottom of a deep body of water.
To talk in a low quiet voice.
An expanse of land often barren of vegetation and people.
A word of uncertain meaning.
A word of uncertain meaning.
What is good or bad, that is desired.
Something that is desired.
Vacant or void of required sources for life.
To be devoid of inhabitants or visitors.
A desolate place.
A word of uncertain meaning.
To look down on with contempt or aversion.
To bring to ruin a structure, existence, or condition.
To detest that which is filthy.
To begin using something new.
Immersed in activity for a specific task.
Moisture condensed on the surfaces of cool bodies or objects, especially at night.
To pass from physical life; to pass out of existence; to come to an end through death. The hiphil (causative) form means "kill."
To break or loosen earth with an instrument or tool. To bargain in the sense of digging.
To dig something out of the ground. To dig into something as if searching. To confuse in the sense of being dug out.
Emitting a limited or insufficient amount of light; seen indistinctly or without clear outlines or details.. To be dark in the eyes or knowledge.
To make less or cause to appear less; to lessen the authority, dignity, or reputation of. Be lacking or to decrease.
To plunge or immerse momentarily or partially, as under the surface of a liquid, to moisten, cool, or coat.
To cause to turn, move, or point undeviatingly or to follow a straight course; give instructions or orders for a path to be taken.
The direction to go. Serving or intended to guide, govern, or influence; serving to point direction.
The quality of being able to grasp and comprehend what is obscure. An intimacy with a person, idea or concept. Knowledge.
A feeling of contempt for what is beneath one; to look with scorn on; to treat something as spoiled or no longer of value.
What brings on an illness.
A scorn, taunting or reproach as a piercing.
Something highly distasteful that arouses marked aversion in one.
unknown clean animal.
To put out of place; to displace, as to dislocate a joint. Beheading by severing the neck..
To separate or remove to a distance apart from each other; to diffuse or cause to break into different parts.
Bitter, sometimes violent conflict or dissension.
To engage in argument; to dispute or chide another in harassment or trial.
To loose the bonds of something. To make something disappear.
Separation in space or time. A distant place or time.
A far off place as hidden beyond the horizon. A far off time as hidden from the present; the distant past or future. A place or time that cannot be perceived.
The state of being in great trouble, great physical or mental strain and stress. To be in pain from grief or heavy toil.
Resulting from grief or heavy toil. This word can also mean an idol or image.
To interfere with; to destroy tranquility; to throw into disorder. Agitate or trouble, as when stirring water.
To separate into two or more parts, areas or groups. To divide in half.
To separate.
To sever or part into sections To distribute or to bestow in parts or shares.
A part of a whole that was divided and separated.
To practice divination.
As cut off from the husband.
To bring to pass; to bring about; to act or make.
The negative of an alternative choice. To be without; to not be.

To perform the duty of the brother-in-law. When a brother dies, it is his brother's responsibility to marry his sister-in-law to provide his brother a child there-by, exalting the woman to her responsibility of bringing a child for her dead husband.
To do something necessary; to be good, in the sense of being "functional."
The adult female fallow deer. Feminine form of a strong one.
An unclean four-footed animal. Also meaning contempt or reproach.
To govern or prevail over as a magistrate; to be in ultimate control; to establish order.
Something given to another in devotion.
A male ass.
A means of access; usually a swinging or sliding barrier by which an entry is closed and opened.
The supporting frame or single post around a door or gate.
To make twice as great or as many. As a second or a multiple of two.
To bend at the waist or middle.
A mass of flour and water that rises when yeast is added and is then baked into bread or cakes.
Any of numerous species of birds, especially a small wild one.
The money, goods, or estate that a woman brings to her husband in marriage.
To squeeze out by wringing.
To pull up or out of a receptacle or place; to draw or pull something out; to prolong in the sense of drawing out time; to draw out a sound from a horn.
To draw out or away as a bowstring or to draw a cord to its breaking point.
To bring close to another.
To empty. To arm oneself by unsheathing a sword in the sense of emptying the scabbard. Acting in vain; empty-handed.
To bale up. To lift the bucket out of the well for drawing water.
To bringing up water from a well, usually using a rope and a bucket.
To come or be brought close.
Great fear, especially in the face of impending evil.
A series of thoughts, images or emotions occurring during sleep.
Dried foods, grains and meat, are carried by the shepherd.
To run into or through as with a pointed weapon or tool; pierce a hole through; to begin in the sense of pressing in.
Having holes.
To swallow liquid, whether of man or of the land.
The act of swallowing water or other liquid. The drinking of the land in the sense of its being watered or irrigated.
To set or keep in motion; to press or force into an activity, course, or direction.
To pour down, pour out to the ground or into a vessel. To pour out anger to another.
A group of animals driven or moving in a body.
To fall, drop, or descend down to a lower level.

An area void of water.
To be dried up as well as withered, ashamed or confused.
To be a dry wasteland; to be laid waste and made desolate.
The color of blood and wine.
The excrement of animals or humans. Manure or refuse.
Fine particles of earth or other material that are easily disturbed to create a cloud.
To remain for a time; to live as a resident; to stay or sit in one location for an indeterminate duration.
The resident of a region. Also a habitation, the place of residence.
A place of habitation or residence.
Impaired or abnormal action other than that for which a person or thing is intended. Something that does not function within its intended purpose.
The organ of hearing; so named from its broad shape.
A hollow box formed out of brick or clay for cooking.
The general direction of sunrise. As in front when facing the rising sun. Also, the ancient past.
The wind that comes from the east. Toward the east as the origin of the east wind.
Toward the east. Before another space or time; as the east is in front when facing the rising sun.

The border or boundary of an object or a region. The thin cutting edge of a blade.

An ordinal number.
The height to which something is raised.
To clasp in the arms; to cherish or love; to take in or include in a larger group or whole.

A decorative work of colorful needlework.

Possibly the Emerald, a green variety of Beryl. The Hebrew word is from a root meaning to flash or shimmer, while the Septuagint uses Smaragdos meaning a green stone. Other possible translations are Beryl or Quartz.
What exerts power and status. Someone or something that is wide in authority or majesty.
The area under the control of a king; a kingdom.
Lack of contents which should be present. Void of contents or purpose.
The lack of intelligence or significance in an action. An action or thought with no positive results. To empty by pouring out.
To be drained away.
To go around to enclose or go about.
Any type of enclosure.
A chance meeting.
To meet or come in contact with another person. A meeting between two hostile factions; to engage in conflict with.
A final point that marks the extent of something. The latter time as coming after everything else.
To furnish with a dower or payment for a bride. Pay the price for a bride. Give a natural gift.
To mark, scratch, or scrape. To chisel or cut figures, letters, or devices on stone or metal.
A sculptor or carver who engraves wood, stone or metal.
A scratching or carving in stone, metal or wood.
A tool making markings or inscriptions by carving on stone, metal or wood. A stylus for inscribing a clay tablet.
To ask about; to search into; to seek to understand what is not known. The hiphil (causative) form means "grant."
Twisted together or interwoven in a confused manner. Involved.
A state of being complete. All of it. No missing parts; complete by including everything.
A place of entering. Once (Zechariah 8:7) used for the west as the place where the sun enters the underworld.
A word of uncertain meaning.
To twist together or around; to become twisted.
To tightly wrap something up.
An apron-like vestment having two shoulder straps and ornamental attachments for securing the breastplate, worn with a waistband by the high priest.
A wide spread disease effecting man or animal. A pestilence.
To make something like something else, or to compare it to something else.
A word of uncertain meaning.
A disease of the skin which breaks open drawing out liquid.
A getting away, especially from confinement. A person or animal that has gotten away.
To make an approximate count or reckoning.
A castrated man. As eunuchs were used as officers, may also mean an officer.
The latter part and close of the day and the early part of the night. Dark of the evening or dark-skinned people. Also the willow from its dark color.
To be removed or thrown from with force. To dispossess, exile, dismiss.
That which proves or disproves something; something that makes plain or clear; an indication or sign.
A female sheep.
To inspect closely; to test, try or scrutinize.
Running over, filled beyond capacity.
With the exclusion of from the whole. The whole with the exception of one or more.
The act of giving or taking one thing in return for another. To buy or sell produce, usually grain. Bartering.
To give out a breath. To blow on a fire or the boiling water in a pot as an exhale.
To have real being whether material or spiritual; to have breath.
Set in place. To be fixed with permanence or continuance. To continue in being.
To forcefully send someone or something out or away; to drive an axe through wood.
Direct observation of or participation in events as a basis of knowledge. Something that is personally encountered, undergone or lived through in its use.
To breathe one’s last breath; the last breath of death.
To provide a meaning.
To cause to be visible or open to public view. In the sense of uncovering.
To set up camp by stretching out the cover of the tent; to extend or stretch in length.
To pull out or toward. To draw weapons for battle.
A full and long life.
The most distant end of something; the corner or edge.
The organ of sight or vision that tears when a person weeps. Also a spring that weeps water out of the ground.
A dry standard of measure equal to 3 se'ahs or 10 omers. The same as the liquid measure bath which is about 9 imperial gallons or 40 liters.
The anterior part of the human head; outward appearance. One present, in the sense of being in the face of another. Always written in the plural form.
To face another or meet face to face; to go before someone or something in space or time.
To degrade a person, action or object. To droop or pass away. To wither away as a leaf. To wear out of strength. To act unproductively.
To miss the target, whether a literal target or a goal that is aimed for. The piel (intensive) form means "reconcile."
A complete destruction or failure of something.
An act or condition of ignorant or imprudent deviation from a code of behavior. A missing of the target in the sense of making a mistake. The sacrifice, which by transference, becomes the sin.
From a blow to the loins.
Lacking courage and spirit; weak, dizzy and likely to pass out. Lacking distinctness.
A word of uncertain meaning.
To leave an erect position suddenly and involuntarily; to descend freely by the force of gravity.
To suddenly and forcefully crash upon someone or something.
As broken from the plant and scattered on the ground.
A deliberate lie. An expression of a non-truth.
Words or actions that are not true or are empty. A Deception. Lacking value and content.
A household idol of a god, possibly believed to have a healing power.
An extreme scarcity of food.
Something least likely to happen.
The concluding part of an area or extremity. Also used for the conclusion of a thought; finally, however, but.
To be joined to another as in a yoke.
What joins together.

Animal tissue consisting of cells distended with greasy or oily matter; adipose tissue. The fat of an animal as the choicest part. Also milk; A white fatty liquid secreted by cows, sheep and goats, and used for food or as a source of butter, cheeses, yogurt, etc.
The fat part of a sheep's rump considered an Eastern delicacy.
A man who has begotten a child. The provider and support to the household. The ancestor of a family line. The patron of a profession or art.
The father of ones wife or husband, father-in-law in the sense of passion
To make more substantial, fleshy or plump; to fill up. The filling of the earth in Genesis 1 with the sun, moon, plants and animals. The filling of man with breath and the image of God.
To be afraid of; to have a strong emotion caused by anticipation or awareness of danger; the flowing, or quivering, of the gut from fear or awe; to dread what is terrible or revere what is respected.
Full of fear or dread.
Inclined to be afraid.
To be afraid or apprehensive.
A commemoration of a special event with dancing, rejoicing, and sharing of food. A ceremony of joy and thanksgiving. A festival with a magnificent meal which is shared with a number of guests.
A member of the livestock that has been fed grains to fatten it for the slaughter.
To give food to; to provide feed or pasture to the flock. Commonly used in the participle form meaning a feeder or shepherd.
A place of feeding or grazing.
To handle or touch in order to examine, test or explore some quality. Reach out with the hand to touch.
An individual that bears children. Designed with a hollow or groove into which a corresponding male part fits, as with a hole.
A female master overseeing slaves or servants.
Devoted to corrupt purposes. A female prostitute set aside for a special purpose.
A walled place of protection and confinement.
To surround with a wall of protection or covering. To encompass completely.
A barrier intended to protect, prevent escape or intrusion, or to mark a boundary; to gather together and confine for protection.
Small in number.
An open land area free of trees and buildings. A level plot of ground.
An ordinal number.
A fifth portion of five equal amounts.
An oblong or pear-shaped fruit from a tree of the fichus genus.
To make war; to battle as to destruction; to attempt to defeat, subdue, or destroy an enemy by blows or weapons. A struggle for victory.
To occupy to the full capacity. The piel (intensive) form means "fulfill."
An act or instance of filling; something used to fill a cavity, container, or depression.
A dirty, shameful, or detestable action, object or condition. Often used in the context of idols.
The fins of a fish.
To come upon, often accidentally; to meet with; to discover and secure through searching.
A financial penalty made for an offense or damages.
A pulverized powder. Also the clouds as a fine powder.
The extension of the hand. Can be used to point.
The span of the fingers, often used as a measurement.
To bring to an end; terminate; to complete an action, event.
The phenomenon of combustion manifested by heat, light and flame.
A sacrifice that is placed in a fire as an offering.
A tray for carrying hot coals.
Securely fixed in place.
The head of a time or position.

The spot to be drilled is first scored to make an indentation to accept the drill. The beginning of the drilling is the most difficult, as the drill can easily slip out. If the first drilling slips, it is difficult to begin a second time.
The firstborn offspring, usually a son, of a man or animal. The prominent one.
The firstborn daughter. The prominent one.
The first gathered fruits of a harvest; the first results of an undertaking.
An aquatic animal. Only fish with scales and fins are considered fit for food (clean).
A division, causing to become two pieces instead of one. A cleft or narrow chasm.
Clenched fingers into the palm of the hand.
A cardinal number, from the number of fingers on a hand.
To scale off particles from an object.
A word of uncertain meaning.
A visible fire, usually used in the sense of a fierce anger.
A fierce anger.
The hollow of the loins between the legs.
To become suddenly excited or angry; to break out suddenly. Burn with a fierce anger.
The bright light shining off the edge of a sword. The bright light of lightning.
As hammered out flat.
The taste of a food or the perception of a person's behavior.
A plant in which its fibers are used in manufacturing articles of clothing. Also used to make wicks, cords, and bands. Linseed, linseed oil, and oilcake are useful products of the same plant.
To run away, often from danger or evil; to hurry toward a place of safety; to flee to any safe place such as a city or mountain.
To run away from.
The shearing of sheep for its fleece. Also the grasses that are sheared off with a sickle in harvest.
The soft parts of a human or animal, composed primarily of skeletal muscle. Skin and muscle or the whole of the person. Meat as food.
Possibly the flint, a form of quartz of a brown, gray or black color. Other possible translations are onyx and diamond.
Groups of birds or animals assembled or herded together.
To cover with an overwhelming quantity or volume of water.
The level base of a room, barn or threshing floor.
Finely ground meal of grain used for making bread.
A green plant bearing fruit. Also prosperous.
To stream or gush a liquid substance. To run like water.
To flow over with copious amounts of water.
To flap the wings rapidly. To move with quick wavering or flapping motions. Shake as a bird in the nest.
To move in or pass through the air with wings; to soar in the air.
A flying creature such as a bird or insect.
To go, proceed or come after. Being next in order or time. Subsequent to. As the river follows the path of its banks.
Lack of good sense or prudence and foresight. In the sense of fading away.
Something that nourishes, sustains, or supplies. For giving sustenance and making one whole.
A substance that may be eaten for giving sustenance and making one whole.
In the sense of fading away.
To be without wisdom.
The terminal part of the leg upon which the human, animal or object stands. Also euphemistically for the leg.
Ground or basis for a firm foundation. That which sustains a stable position.
A stroke of time as a rhythmic beating of time, one moment after the other. A moment in time. A foot or leg in the sense of stepping.
An exchange for something else.
The pressure exerted to make a piercing.
A strong grip on something to refrain or support. Driven with force. Acting with power.
A linear standard of measure equal to the length of the forearm.
In front of or at the head of, in space or time.
The part of the face which extends from the hair on the top of the head to the eyes. Impudence, confidence, or assurance. The seat of boldness of speech and actions.
Situated outside one's own country. Alien in character. A strange person, place or thing as being unrecognized.
A person belonging to or owing allegiance to a foreign country.
A fold of skin that covers the end of the penis.
A dark place dense with trees.
To lose remembrance of; to cease remembering or noticing.
To pardon; to overlook an offense and treat the offender as not guilty.
An implement, or tool with multiple prongs or tines.
A word of uncertain meaning.
A store of material possessions.
To lay a foundation of a house, place or plan.
A supporting and level base of a building or structure which lies on or in the ground.
A spring that comes out of a hole in the ground. The source of water necessary for life in the wilderness.
A cardinal number.
An ordinal number.
A great-great grandchild, as a descendant of the fourth generation.
As fourth in the order.
Meaning dubious.
A part broken off, detached, or incomplete. The removal of a piece resulting in a hole.
A sweet smelling spice.
A resin or gum that is a residue from the bark of a particular ash or fir tree. Used as incense, perfume, or with an offering.
Released from bondage or burden of obligation. Emancipation.
To be free from a master or obligation.
To flow without hindrances.
Having no restrictions. A work or action that is performed without wages or without cause.
A voluntary or spontaneous gift as an offering out of respect or devotion.
Something that is fresh and moist.
Newly pressed wine as a desired possession.
A female companion as one who is close.
A tassel or lock of hair as blossoms.
A four-legged amphibious animal.
A function word indicating a starting point or origin.
The liquid that seeps out of the fruit and used in making oils and juices.
A noun of uncertain meaning.
Containing as much or as many as is possible or normal.
Someone or something that is whole or complete. Full in power or force. One who is mature.
Fulfilling the action for which a person or thing is specially fitted or used, or for which a thing exists. A functioning within its intended purpose.
An enclosed structure in which heat is produced.
Made by oxen plowing a field.
At a distance beyond the present place or time.
Intense, disordered, and often destructive rage. An intense heat from anger.
An odoriferous resin used in incense. A choice ingredient used in the Temple incense or oil.
The bitter fluids of a serpent.
Animals being pursued or taken in hunting. The produce of the hunt.
A plot of ground where crops are grown. A place for growing crops, and often surrounded by a rock wall or hedge to protect it from grazing animals.
From its strong odor.
An article of clothing for covering.
The opening in a wall or fence through which livestock or people pass. Can be the gatekeeper. Also sha'ar, a unit of measurement.
To bring together; to accumulate and place in readiness.
To come or bring into a group, mass or unit.
To bring together. Acquire.
That which has been brought together. [.
An animal of a herd in the sense of an army.
A body of living beings constituting a single step in the line of descent from an ancestor.
The feeling of shame when exposed.
A characterstic trait of being meek or humble.
A dry weight measure equal to a 20th part of a shekel.
To endow with some power, quality, or attribute; the act, power or right of giving. What is given.
To pull in closely to the body. To wrap around. To tie on the ephod.
To bind the loose portions of clothing into a belt or sash to prepare to go to war; to be bound with arms for war.
A young, unmarried woman.
To make a present; to present a gift; to grant, allow or bestow by formal action.
To tithe; a tenth part of something given voluntarily for the support of a religious establishment.
To assist another by providing wise counsel.
To pay attention to a voice or sound; to hear with thoughtful attention and obedience.
Someone or something that is wide in size or majesty. To honor. To puff up.
To provide nourishment to the young by the female.
Prone or disposed to according to what preceded. A reference to the previous or following context.
The flash of light from a fire or metal.
The flash of light from a fire or metal.
Emitting or reflecting light. From the glisten of olive oil. Something that shines brightly. Also, noon as the brightest part of the day.
A shaking from fear or overeating.
A small flying insect.
To go back an forth as a whip.
To circle completely around something.
To turn aside or away.
To go or come lower from a higher place. The hiphil (causative) form means "bring down."
To go, come or issue forth.
To choose, turn or go to the right hand.
To go, come or bring higher. The hiphil (causative) form means "bring up."
A cup for containing liquids.
Coming or issuing out, such as a spring or words from the mouth.
A malleable yellow metallic element that is used especially in coins, jewelry, and dentures. A precious metal.
Something that has economic utility or satisfies an economic want; personal property having intrinsic value but usually excluding money, securities and negotiable instruments.
Wood from an unknown tree.
To stab with the horns.
An ox that is known to gore with the horns.
An official elected or appointed to act as ruler, chief executive, or nominal head of a political unit. One who has dominion over another; also a rule or law as a master.
A seed or fruit of a cereal grass. The grain and the field as a place for growing grain.
Usually finely ground seeds of wheat.
A usually flexible container that may be closed for holding, storing, or carrying something; e.g. The mouth is spread apart to put something in or take something out.
A family of grasses used for food. As traded or sold.
The tall stem of cereal crops.
A smooth-skinned juicy greenish white to deep red or purple berry grown on a vine and eaten dried or fresh as a fruit or fermented to produce wine.
The flower of a seed plant. From its bright color and shape as like a spark. Also, an unknown bird of prey.
A woody vine that usually climbs by tendrils and produces fruits that are grapes.
A hand-to-hand struggle. Rolling around in the dust when wrestling.
A firm hold or grip.
To grab with the hands, to grab a handful.
Herbage suitable or used for grazing animals. Young green sprouts.
An agricultural device, like a sieve, used to separate the grain form the stem.
An excavation for the burial of a body.
One who has gray hair from old age; an old man.
Something with increased size, power or authority.
A word of Egyptian origins.
The strongest of the woods.
A color somewhat less yellow than that of fresh growing grass and of that part of the spectrum between blue and yellow. The color of grasses and herbs as thin.
Fresh young stalks of standing grain. Also the name of a month in the Hebrew calendar.
Deep and poignant distress caused by or as if by bereavement. As an exchange.
To reduce to fine particles through abrasion.
To voice a deep, inarticulate sound, as of pain, grief, or displeasure.
To feel about blindly or uncertainly in search of something. A groping around in the darkness to find something.
The surface of the earth. From its reddish color.
An area of planted trees. Trees planted in a straight line.

To be fat or full of oil.
One who leads or directs another in his way.
The fact of having committed a breach of conduct especially violating law and involving a penalty; the state of one who has committed an offense, especially consciously.
To drink plentifully; to swallow hurriedly or greedily or in one swallow.
A sudden brief rush of wind. The strong blowing of a wind. The wind of a bird's wing when taking flight.
To drink greedily, continually, or habitually. A drinking of water as from a pond.
The dwelling place of a god (temple), man (home) or animal (den). Also a retreat.
A precipitation in the form of irregular pellets or balls of ice.
The covering of filaments on a human head or the body of an animal.
Being of an unusual amount of hair, often in reference to a goat.
An equal part of something divided into two pieces.
For leading an animal.
To beat a malleable metal with a hammer to make thin sheets.
The terminal, functional part of the forelimb. Hand with the ability to work, throw and give thanks. Also euphemistically for the arm.
A linear standard of measure that is equal to the span of the fingers of the hand.
As much of or as many as the hand can grasp.
To suspend with no support from below.
A state of well-being and contentment. One who is happy is one whose life is lived straightly.
A feeling of joy or satisfaction.
Enjoying well-being and contentment. One who is happy is one whose life is lived straightly.
To press into a tight place, an oppression.
Not easily penetrated; resistant to stress; firm; lacking in responsiveness.
Privation; suffering; something that causes or entails suffering or privation.
Physical or mental damage; injury. The pain from the thorn.
An armor made from tightly wound cords of leather.
A plucked stringed musical instrument;
The season for gathering agricultural crops. Time when the plants are severed from their roots to be used for seed or food.
A hurried action.
To hurry in flight.
Intense hostility and aversion, usually deriving from fear, anger, or sense of injury; extreme dislike or antipathy.
To have a feeling of deep sympathy and sorrow for another who is stricken by misfortune, accompanied by a strong desire to alleviate the suffering.
One of a pair of bony processes that arise from the head of many animals, sometimes used as a wind instrument. The horn-shaped protrusions of the altar or a musical instrument.
A light brown to strong yellowish brown color; small trees or shrubs bearing nuts enclosed in a leafy involucres.
The male who is neither speaker nor hearer.
A male goat.
The top of the body. A person in authority or role of leader. The top, beginning or first of something.
A conglomeration of grain seeds together.
A bowl shaped covering for the head. A covering for protection.
A support for the head. Place where the head is laid.
To restore to health or wholeness.
A large pile dirt or rubbish.
To perceive or apprehend by the ear; to listen to with attention. To obey.
One who listens. The one who acts upon what he has heard.
Literally, the vital organ which pumps blood, but, also seen as the seat of thought; the mind.
Natural body warmth, as well as the time of estrous when animals mate. Conception from an animal’s mating or through the heat of passion.
A physical or spiritual weight. A sadness or burden.
Having great weight. Something that is weighty. May also be grief or sadness in the sense of heaviness. Also, the liver as the heaviest of the organs.
What is restrained when taking a step forward.
A young cow, especially one that has not had a calf.
The highest part or most advanced point; the condition of being tall or high. In the sense of being raised up.
One who inherits or is entitled to inherit property.
Providing assistance or relief to another. One who comes to assist with a trouble or burden.
To give assistance or support to.
The outer edge of a garment.
The grasses and plants of the field used for their medicinal, savory, or aromatic qualities.
A plant used as food for men and animals as grown in the yard.
In or at this place.
Stones that are sheered or chipped to form flat sides or an object.
An unknown animal that burrows in the ground.
An unknown animal.
To put out of sight; to conceal from view; to keep secret. Hide or conceal.
A shelter or other place of hiding.
Advanced in height such as a wall or hill.
A road constructed above the surrounding area.
An elevation of land such as a hill or mountain.
Each side of the trunk formed by the lateral parts of the pelvis and upper part of the femur (thigh bone) together with the fleshy parts covering them.
The seat of confidence. In a foolish or proper manner.
Payment for labor or personal services; to engage the personal service of another.
One who is hired for service and receives compensation.
To deliver a blow by action; to strike with the hand; to clap, kill or harm.
A word of uncertain meaning.
A liquid measure equal to about 5 quarts (6 liters).
A covering of small ice crystals, formed from frozen water vapor.
The act of performing a celebration.
Be unwilling to give in or admit to.
To hinder the progress or achievement of; restrain, as the banks of a river hold back the water.
To continue in the same condition without failing or losing effectiveness or force. Be a support or aid for strength or rest.
Property that is held or owned.
To pierce through creating a cavity.
A sweet material elaborated out of the nectar of flowers in the honey sac of various bees. Also, dates as a thick, sticky and sweet food.
Someone or something that has been enlarged in size, pride or majesty.
A covering of the entire head and face.
A straight piece of wood or metal that is bent at one end.
To jump from one position to another. Also, to be lame, as one who hops on one leg.
The feast celebrating the "hopping" (usually called "Passover" but more literally means "hop over").
A large swarm of flies in the sense of a mixture. Also used for a large group of people.
One of a pair of bony processes that arise from the head of many animals and used as a wind instrument. The horns of an animal or a musical instrument in the shape of a horn.
A flying insect with a stinger that is capable of causing serious injury or death to one that is stung.
A domesticated animal used as a beast of burden, a draft animal or for riding.
One that rides a horse.
Conflict, opposition, or resistance; overt acts of warfare.
Having a relatively high temperature; eager; passionate.
A spring with water above body temperature.
The structure or the family, as a household that resides within the house. A housing. Within.
In what way or manner; by what means.
An unknown duration of time.
Of, relating to, or characteristic of man. The first man. All of mankind as the descendants of the first man.
As a lump of the back.
A specific number but also a large amount without any reference to a specific number.
A craving or urgent need for food.
To attempt to find something with the intent to capture. Hunt in the sense of laying in ambush.
One who searches for something. Lays in ambush.
To throw down with violence. The area which a bow can be shot from a central point.
To carry or cause to go with haste.
As a cavity.
An aromatic herb whose twigs were used in ceremonial sprinkling.
A person aware of possessing a personal identity in self-reference.
Frozen water. Cold ice, frost or crystals.
The image of a god made from wood or stone that is revered.
Allowing that; on condition that. A desire to bind two ideas together.
Also a woman's cycle.
A reproduction or imitation of the form of a person or thing. The form of something as a shadow of the original.
The casting of an image.
A twisting together of thoughts.
To drink strong drink that can cause intoxication.
To follow as a model, pattern or example.
Someone from outside of the homeland. Someone who migrated from another land or country.
Before or opposite to something.
One related by marriage.
As an arrangement.
To do something in a certain manner; a reference to the previous or following context.
Usually made of several spices and or fruits, etc. To emit a fragrance. Used at the altar as a sweet savor.
To become progressively greater; to multiply by the production of young; to be abundant of number, strength or authority.
To become progressively greater; to multiply by the production of young. Multiply. Also, meaning "to shoot" from the abundant arrows of the archer.
A word of uncertain meaning.
Without any question.
As drawn out of the mother.
To taint or contaminate with something that affects quality, character, or condition unfavorably. To be infected with leprosy, mildew or mold.
A contaminated substance, such as a disease, mold or mildew, on the skin, cloth or a building.
A piercing pain.
To excite to excessive or uncontrollable action or feeling.
A passing down of properties, wealth or blessings to the offspring.
The acquisition of a possession from past generations.
Freedom from guilt or sin through being unacquainted with evil. A state of innocence as an infant.
Free from guilt or sin. A state of innocence as an infant.
To write, engrave or print as a lasting record. A decree or custom.
Placed in its proper and permanent position.
The ability to learn, reason, plan and build.
To intervene between parties to reconcile differences. Supplicate on the behalf of another.
From usury.
To explain or tell the meaning of.
The act or result of interpreting.
To enter for conquest or plunder. The slicing through of a band of men.
A product of the imagination. Designing or planning of inventions or plans.
To look or search for something.
A heavy element frequently used in the making of weapons and tools. The most used of metals.
A tract of land surrounded by water. Also a country in the sense of isolated.
To flow out; to go, pass, or flow out; emerge.
A utensil or implement usually for carrying or storing various materials.
A sudden and unexpected shake; a wide-mouthed container.
Probably the Jasper which may be red, yellow or brown in color. The Septuagint uses laspis meaning Jasper. Other possible translations are Ruby, Hyacinth and Emerald.
From the moist cheeks.
A precious stone. Something of value.
To bind together.
Two becoming one purposely.
The attachment of objects through binding together.
The point at which two opposing objects meet.
The packing up of camp for the purpose of beginning a journey.
To travel or pass from one place to another; to break camp and begin a journey.
One who presides over a dispute.
Reward for action, good or bad. An aspect of determining the outcome.
A vessel used for storage of water, grain, etc.
As loosened from the fruit.
An unknown tree.
To hold onto.
To hold something back or restrain.
To refrain from disclosing information.
To stand still and be silent.
To be on the look-out for danger or opportunity.
The 'coccus ilicis,' a worm used for medicinal purposes as well as for making a crimson dye.
The seed of a grape as sharp.
A supernatural creature, identified in other Semitic cultures as a winged lion, a Griffin.
An organ of the body. The seat of emotion in Hebraic thought.
To deprive of life; to slaughter.
A near female relative.
A category of creature that comes from its own kind as a firm rule.
One who shows favor, mercy or compassion to another.
To kindle a fire.
Of a sympathetic nature; quality or state of being sympathetic. In the sense of bowing the neck to another as a sign of kindness.
A group of related individuals.
The male ruler of a nation or city state.
The area under the control of a king.
To touch together as when kissing with the lips or in battle with weapons.
To work and press dough. Knead dough for bread.
The vessel used for mixing bread dough.
The joint between the femur and tibia of the leg.
To bend the knee, to kneel in homage or to kneel down to get a drink water. The piel (intensive) form means "respect," in the sense of kneeling before another.
A cutting instrument consisting of a sharp blade and handle. What is used for preparing and eating food.
An ornamental round lump or protuberance on the surface or at the end of something.
To knock a tree to remove its fruit, also a threshing.
A small round hill.
To have an intimate and personal understanding; to have an intimate relationship with another person, usually sexual.
One with special knowledge.
An unknown bitter plant.
To exert one’s power of body or mind, especially with painful or strenuous effort. A labor that causes grief, pain or weariness. A laborer as one who toils.

An aromatic gum resin obtained from a tree and having a bitter slightly pungent taste.
Used to raise up. A structure for climbing up or down.
As one who hops one leg.
To mourn aloud; wail.
The act of mourning.
A container for an inflammable liquid, as oil, which is burned at a wick as a means of illumination.
A platform, sometimes elevated, for holding a lamp.
The solid part of the earth's surface. The whole of the earth or a region.

In, to or toward the back. To be in back of, at the rear or following after something.
The previous night or a time past.
The latter part of the day, in the sense of night as being dark. The latter part of a season. At or near the end.
A late rain that causes a latter growth of crops.
To show mirth, joy, or scorn with a smile and chuckle or explosive sound.
The sound of or as of laughing.
A law, decree or edict.
To give up; to lie down for copulation, rest or sleep.
To hide in ambush.
The location one lays for rest or sleep.
A very heavy metal that is commonly melted and poured into casts to make statues or other objects.

One who is in charge or in command of others.
Foliage of a tree or plant. As high in the tree.

Teachings and instructions that are received in the sense of being taken.
To go away from; to neglect.

To put something in a place.

The appendage from the ankle to the hip and bends at the knee.
A measured distance or dimension.
A leguminous plant with flattened edible seeds.
To be left behind by those who leave.
A depression in the earth’s surface between ranges of mountains. Wide level valley as a division between mountains ranges.
The cover of a box or other container.

A leader who is responsible for a group of thirty.

Raised up in position or in exaltation.

One who carries light into the darkness.
Something that is light in weight or position (worthless).

A horizontal architectural member supporting the weight above an opening, as a window or a door.
A large carnivorous chiefly nocturnal cat. A feared animal.
A female lion.
The rim or edge of the mouth or other opening. Language, as spoken from the lips.
An intoxicating drink.
Small in size or extent. Something or someone that is smaller, younger or less significant.

Having the vigor of life.
Animals kept or raised for use or pleasure. What is purchased or possessed.

From the camouflaging capability of the lizard to hide.
To draw attention to something important.
Something that is lifted up and carried. The lifting up of the voice in song.
That which is put on a person or pack animal to be carried.
To dislike greatly and often with disgust. To be sickened as if pierced by a thorn.
The extended point of the liver.
From its high jumping.
A room on top of the house used during hot days of summer.
A standard of measure.
A sash or belt that encircles the waist.
The pubic region; the generative organs. In the sense of the next generation being drawn out of the loins.
As let loose.
To ascertain by the use of one's eyes.
To look out and down as through a window.
To look upon with high regard.
A circular object that is open in the middle.
To uncover, remove or let go. Such as to make naked by removing clothing. To uncover the head.
To make less tight; slacken or relax. To untie or remove.
The ruler as the foundation to the community.
Departed from the correct path or way, either out of ignorance or revolt.
An object that is missing or misplaced.
Colored stones that are thrown and read to determine a course of action or to make a decision.
A loud, confused, constant noise or sound

To be brought down low in humility or submission.
The part beneath. A low place.
Brought down.
A low place.
That which gives off light.
A laying with another in copulation. Something spread out.
The larvae of flies.
