An increased significance or size.
To increase in size or one's position of honor.
An unmarried young woman.
Elevated to a higher position. Supreme greatness or authority.

To promise solemnly; to make an agreement where one promises an action if the other reciprocates with another action.

Being the gender who begets offspring. One who acts and speaks for the family.
A male member of a flock of goats.
A young goat.
A male prostitute set aside for a special purpose.
An adult male human. As mortal. Also, used to mean "each" in the sense of an individual.
A plant boiled as an aphrodisiac.
A large but indefinite number. An abundance of things (many, much, great), actions (complete, wholly, strong, quick) or character (very).

A mark or emblem used to identify a purpose.
To join as husband and wife.
The tall grasses that line a marsh as a wall.
Something that causes wonder or astonishment. To see or perceive a full sight, such as a wonder or miracle.
Having chief authority; a workman qualified to teach apprentices.
Something owned, occupied or controlled. The goods and wealth acquired from the idea of acquiring materials for building a nest.
A word or utterance spoken about something.
Having completed natural growth and development. An upright and correct nature.

A calculated measurement of weight.
A size or distance that is determined by comparing to a standard of measure.
A word of uncertain meaning.
Solid food as distinguished from drink; flesh; a meal.
To struggle with to gain control over.
To engage in contemplation. A sweeping away in thought.

A planned or accidental coming together. An encounter.
A fruit that clings to the vine.
To become liquefied by warmth or heat. Also, the dissolving of the heart through fear or discouragement.
A remembering and action based on a past even.
A remembering based on a past event often through an annual festival.
Male persons.
One who bears a message or runs an errand. Walks for another.
Thin layers of metals used to cover materials to give the look of metal. A hammered out sheet of gold used to overlay something.

The absolute center.
The lower abdomen and back.
The center or middle of the whole.
One who holds authority over others, such as a judge, chief or god. In the sense of being yoked to one another.

As a thin green film.

A large circular stone that is revolved on top of another stone to grind grain into flour.

An annoying action resulting in grief, harm or evil.
An agony of the heart.
A vapor or fine spray.
To combine in one mass; to mingle together.
A gathering of people.
Two or more elements to create one new element. Also the woof in weaving from its mixing of colors.
To rule over quarrels or other conflicts.
A judge. One who presides over a dispute.
Slightly or moderately wet.
To give shape to; to press or squeeze, as when pressing clay into a shape to form a vessel.
Material used to encompass an area or to enhance or beautify. Spread or scattered over a large area.
A single point in time. A wink of the eye.
A lasting evidence, reminder, or example of someone or something. As standing tall and firm.
The second brightest object in the sky which reflects the sun's light. Also, a month by counting its cycles.
In addition to what has been said.
The time from sunrise to noon. Breaking of daylight.
The next day. At a time following.
Subject to death. As mortal.

To hide in ambush.

A flowing of tears. Also, a meadow as a weeping ground.

A great number of people. A loud group.
A killing committed with malice aforethought, characterized by deliberation or premeditation.

A continuously low or indistinct sound. A complaining in low tones, usually in private.
An art of sound in time that expresses ideas and emotions in significant forms through the elements of rhythm, melody, harmony, and color.
To gather together a group for service, work or war.
Inability to speak. A bound up tongue.
A great abundance in numbers.
A sweet smelling spice. Used as an exchange due to its monetary value.
Without clothes in the sense of bare skin.
The state of being without clothing. Idiomatic for sexual relations.
Of slender width. A narrow, tight place or situation, a difficulty. An enemy or adversary as one who closes in with pressure.
A hollow in the land.
An unknown precious stone.
A community of people of one or more nationalities and having a more or less defined territory and government. The people as the back, or body of the nation.
Born and raised in the Land.
Close to; at or within a short distance from. Also, a kin, as a near relative.
The part of a person that connects the head with the body.
An ornamental chain, band or cord worn around the neck.
A series of links worn as an ornament or insignia in the sense of being spread over the neck.
In a condition of need or want.
An unknown bird, but probably a hawk or eagle.
A bed or receptacle prepared by a bird for its eggs and young. The stall of an animal as a nest.

A sheet of meshed fabric, cord or metal.
In spite of that. A flowing of certainty.
Something that is new, renewed, restored or repaired.

A cardinal number. The total number of hours in an ancient day or night.
Possessing outstanding qualities or properties. Of high birth or exalted rank. One who has authority. May also mean "heavy" from the weight of responsibility on one in authority.
A female of authority.
A quick downward motion of the head. To shake or wag out of pity, sorrow or wandering.
In the sense of nodding ones head when wandering about.

From the North Star which is watched for direction.
The organ bearing the nostrils on the anterior of the face. The nostrils when used in the plural form. Also meaning anger from the flaring of the nostrils and the redness of the nose when angry.
A round piece of jewelry, usually of a metal, that is pierced through the nose or lip.
A function word to stand for the negative. As being without.
Food; nutriment. For giving sustenance and making one whole.
At the present time or moment.
Without clothes in the sense of bare skin.
A sum of units. Counting as a recording.
Involving more than one.
The tough durable wood of the oak tree. Strongest of the woods.
A location where there is freedom from activity or labor; a place for resting or lodging.
Something corroborated by a vow. A binding agreement, including the curse for violating the oath.
Submission to the will of another. In the sense of being restrained.
The exceeding of due bounds or limits.
To give from a willing heart.
Given of one's free will without recompense.
A donation presented to another.
A passionate cry of desire.
A semi-liquid, often oily and thick. Usually olive oil and used as a medicinal ointment. Also, meaning fat or rich.
An oil or other liquid that is smeared on an animal or person for healing or dedication.
A mixture of spices for an ointment or perfume.
One up in years.
The fruit or the tree. The fruit of the olive is used for food and as a source of oil.
Probably the Olivine, a green gemstone. The Septuagint uses the word topazios, but the Topaz was unknown at the time of the Exodus. Another possible meaning of this word is Chrysolite.
A dry measure equal to one tenth of an ephah (about two liters).
A telling of what occurred previously. Thus used in Hebrew as a rolling back around.
A soldier, messenger or traveler who moves on foot.
Existing, acting, or considered as a single unit, entity, or individual.
A portion that is equal to the remainder.
An equal part of something divided into ten parts.
A single instance or thing and nothing more or different.
An unknown precious stone.
Probably the Onyx, a form of quartz that may be of any color. The Septuagint uses beryllios (Beryl). Another possible translation is the Malachite.
Possibly the Opal, which may be found in a wide variety of colors. Other possible translates are Amber, Jacinth, Agate or Amethyst.
To open up as opening a gate or door; to have no confining barrier. The piel (intensive) form means "engrave."
A place for grazing livestock, usually on the outskirts of a village or city.
To make available or accessible. Open the eyes or ears to see or hear.
Something that is open, as an entrance or opening of a tent, house or city.
To possess an intimate knowledge.
One who is on the opposing side of an action or thought; an adversary.
Something in front of; on the other side; in the presence of.
To press into or on another through for force or deceit.
An alternative or optional desire.
A place, person or thing that is not set apart for a specific function.
Something that lends grace and beauty. Precious ornaments probably with gems.
A circular band worn as an ornament.
Having no mother or father.
One that remains or follows after another.
As being across from this side.
In a different manner or way.
An expression of need, or help or injustice. A loud wail from distress.
The furthest from the center. The end.
Garments worn over top of other garments.
The out edge of something.
A place or region beyond an enclosure or barrier.
A chamber used for baking, heating or drying. As a lamp for cooking.
To get the better of. Be successful in strength or authority.
What is left over. A remnant. Residue or overhanging.
To proceed beyond any given or supposed limit or measure. To extend beyond proper bounds. To be superfluous.
To cover with a different material, usually with gold.
To unintentionaly look past, forget.
One who carefully watches over; a superintendent.
Watchful and responsible care.
To catch up with; to remove in the sense of taking over.
To ruin or break into pieces by throwing or pulling down. Meaning Dubious.
The covering of a dwelling place.
To turn something over or upside down, as if pouring out its contents.
The act of turning something over.
Possessor of an article or property.
A domestic bovine animal used for pulling heavy loads.
A bundle arranged for carrying.
As built in high places.
A tropical tree with fan-shaped leaves. Part of the hand or foot between the base of the digits and the wrist or ankle. A palm-shaped object.
A place of pressing as one leans on it. A wall that is placed around the roof as this place was occupied because of its coolness in the summer.
A section or portion of land that has been purchased or aquired.
A dry and arid region, a desert.
To shrivel or toast with intense heat.
To separate. Part the lips to open the mouth.
One that shares. A close companion.
To pass through, by or over something. Also, to change in the sense of going to another one, side or thought. The piel (intensive) form means "change."
A time that is before.
To smear a paste such as mortar on bricks or tar on a boat.
The place where the flock gathers.
The road or route one travels.
A model or instructions detailing a construction.
Something that is paid.
One of lower rank, or value, usually dwelling in a town without walls.
A base that is firm and functions as a supports.
The skin or rind of a fruit; to strip off an outer layer.
To strip off an outer layer; to spread apart; to invade in the sense of spreading out for an attack; to strip off clothing in the sense of spreading the garment for removal.
A peg, nail or hook as used for attaching one thing to another.
A large group of men or women.
To be able to understand on a higher level; to see something that is not physically present.
An unknown bird of prey.
To fill with holes. To make holes.
Something filled with holes or is perforated. Also something accursed in the sense of being filled with holes.
To do a wondrous action that shows ones might.
A wondrous action.
The act of doing, displaying, or creating.
To be deserted or abandoned; separated from the whole, life or functionality.
Something that is continual.
To agitate mentally or spiritually; worry; disturb.
An individual, a man.
A plague or other disaster that smites people or beasts.
An unknown serpent, from its open mouth.
To take hold of and lift up; to gather together.
A part of the original. What has been cut from the whole.
To pierce through with a sword or other sharp object.
To make a hole by puncturing or penetrating; to curse in the sense of piercing through.
Bread that has many holes, as perforated.
To mound up in a heap.
To heap something up in a mound.
A journey of a pilgrim; the course of life on earth. One who travels in a strange land. The pilgrimage or the dwelling place of a stranger.
A standing upright post or column.
The lowest or deepest part of anything.
A greenish-yellow nut from a small tree of the same name. From its belly shape.
A hole in the skin from disease.
A sticky substance used to seal wood from water leakage.
To set up camp. By extension, can also mean a distant shining, such as the moon.
Having or showing sympathetic consciousness of others’ distress with a desire to alleviate it.
To put or set in a particular place, position, situation, or relation.
An establishment for lodging and entertaining travelers. A place for spending the night.
A specific location used for burning incense.
An epidemic disease causing high mortality. An epidemic or other sore or illness as a touch from God.
A level, or straight, place.
A woven or checkered work.
To put or set into the ground for growth; to establish plants in the sense of setting into place in the soil.
A field that produces an abundance of fruit.
To spread plaster out on a surface.
A place higher than the surrounding area. Often used in reference to sacred, or exalted, places.
A large plate, serving dish.
To entreat or appeal earnestly; to fall to the ground to plead a cause to one in authority; prevent a judgment.
Having qualities that tend to give pleasure. An object of desire.
A pleading or request for action from another.
A state of gratification.
What is given as security for a loan.
A full or more than adequate supply. What is full, satisfied or abundant.
To devise a plan of action, usually with evil intent.
Breaking up the ground in order to plant a crop. The time of plowing.
The cutting point of a plow.
To make music by plucking an instrument. To pick fruit.
To take off something or someone by force through picking off, robbing or plundering.
To draw or pull out.
To pull or dig out the roots.
What is drawn or pulled out.
From its long and bowed neck. The soft feathers of the storks neck.
To commit robbery or looting.
The sharp pointed talon of a bird. Also a fingernail or the sharp point of a flint.
To identify a mark.
The bent bar of the yoke that goes around the neck, also a branch that is used as pole.
A sweet deep red fruit prolific with seeds. A symbol of compassion and love.
A collection of water, either natural or manmade. Once (Jeremiah 51:32) used for the reeds which line the pond.
A tree with white bark.
An individual’s part or share of something. The portions dispersed out.
To come into possession of or receive especially as a right or divine portion; o receive from an ancestor at his death; to take possession, either by seizing or through inheritance.
Something that is personally owned.
Being within the limits of ability, capacity, or realization. A possible outcome. To desire what you are without in the sense of joining.
The place at which a soldier is stationed. As standing tall and firm. A garrison.
The offspring of a progenitor to the furthest generation. Continuation through the next generation.
A vessel used for cooking or storing.
Used for making pottery. Skin irritations are treated by applying clay to the irritation and left to dry. Clay left in the sun dries.
A group of things fastened together for convenient handling. Something that is bound up tightly.
To cause to flow in a stream; to give full expression to.
To send a liquid from a container into another container or onto a person or object; to pour molten metal into a cast.
To let flow a liquid, often the blood of an animal in sacrifice or a man.
A liquid poured out as an offering.
A liquid poured out as an offering or the pouring of a molten metal to form images.
Those who rely on benefits from others.
Matter in a fine particulate state. An abundant amount of powdery substance as dust or ash.

Possession of control, authority, or influence over others; physical might. The power or might of one who rules or teaches. One who yokes with another. Often applies to rulers or a god. Often used in the plural form literally meaning "mighty ones," but often used in a singular sense to mean "The Mighty One."
What is choice, precious or excellent.
What is stored away and protected.
To rain or snow.
A rain, snow or exceptionally heavy dew.
The quality of containing unborn young within the body. From the mound of the belly.
Containing unborn young within the body.
To put in proper condition or readiness. The piel (intensive) form means "establish."
A gift given to another in respect as if on bended knee. Also, a pool of water as a place where one kneels down to drink from.
To watch over or guard for protection.
Pressure or pushing action.
To push or urge another into an action.
To confine or restrict in a tight place.
Extracting the fluids from the olive.
An animal taken as food by a predator. The meat that is torn by the predator.
A sharp thorn that causes pain.
A lifting up in a positive or negative sense.
A female of authority.
A place of confinement.
One who is bound or confined.
Agricultural products, especially fresh fruits and vegetables. The harvested product of a crop.
The growth of fruits and crops from flooding waters.
Total output of a commodity or an industry. An increase of produce, usually of fruit.
A valuable return; to derive benefit. The taking of money or something of value through force in the sense of cutting.
A weapon that is sent by the hand. Also a plant shoot as sent out of the ground.
To lengthen or delay.
To utter the words or instructions of Elohiym received through a vision or dream.
One who utters the words or instructions of Elohiym that are received through a vision or dream.
One gifted with more than ordinary spiritual and moral insight. Who brings forth the inner fruit.
An offering.
To succeed; to move forward in distance, position or in thriving.
As paid with food.
Shielded from harm or destruction, in the sense of being hidden.
One who provides rescue or help to another.
Dry food for domestic animals. A gathering of food.
To give what is due; to grant or allow permission.
Supply nourishment.
To rescue or give help to another, to treat as valuable. The hitpael (reflexive) form means "beseech."
A stock of needed materials. The produce of the hunt. Also, used for "food" in general.
To pull out, up or off.
To continually beat something to make it small or turn to powder.
To acquire ownership or occupation through an exchange.
Unmixed with any other matter. A man, animal or object that is free of impurities or is not mixed.
A reddish-blue color used to dye yarn and used in weaving.
To follow in order to overtake, capture, kill, or defeat; to pursue in chase or persecution.
To drive oxen or men.
A swelling irritation that festers on the skin. An inflammatory pustule as an eruption.
An unknown bird that vomits up its food for its chicks.
A unit of value, money.
A small bird used as a food.
A large amount.
A rather loud verbal disagreement.
One portion from the whole that has been divided into four equal parts. One side of a four sided square. A fourth.
An unknown stone.
A female ruler of a region.
To act on a matter as soon as possible.
Without noise, without making a sound.
A case for holding or carrying arrows. As hung over the shoulder.
An unknown bird of prey with a keen sense of sight.
The beams which the roof of the house sits on.
An unknown species of bird.
Clothing; garments.
The rain of the skies.
As the hair from heaven.
To lift something up.
Lifted up in position or in exaltation.
A member of a flock of sheep or goats.
The horn of ram made into a trumpet that emits a bright and beautiful sound.
A fortified enclosure.
A row, line, or series of things or persons.
The act of requiring, or paying, a price for something that was stolen or wrongfully taken.
To Pay the price stipulated, to retrieve what has been stolen or wrongfully taken.
A stipulated amount given to retrieve what has been stolen or wrongfully taken.
A noun of uncertain meaning.
A glossy black bird. As black in color.
Uncooked meat. Meat that is not fit for consumption.
For shaving hair and making the face naked. For holding a blade.
To touch or grasp; to get up to or as far as; to come together in meeting by chance; to give or place in the sense of a meeting.
A designed device.
To oppose or disobey one in authority or control.
A communication directed toward a disorderly person to effect a return to their rightful place of order.
To take or accept what has been given.
Marked by lack of proper caution.
To appoint, assign, count or number a set of things or people.
To acknowledge or take notice of in some definite way.
In the sense of making complete.
Of the color red. Ruddy; florid.
A dark grayish ruddy color.

To buy back. Restore one to his original position or avenge his death. In the participle form this verb means "avenger," as it is the role of the nearest relative to buy back one in slavery or avenge his murder.
A wind instrument made of reeds.
The plants that grow at the edge, or lip, of a river or pond. This word can also mean the edge or conclusion of something.
To reduce to a pure state.
An oil or other substance that is free of impurities. Also, a person without impurities.
The return of light or sound waves from a surface; production of an image as by a mirror.
A place one may run to for safety from an avenger.
To take shelter or place ones trust in someone or something of support.
To express one's self as being unwilling to accept.
Rejection of a proposal, denial.
An area surrounded by a specific border.
To govern or correct according to rule; to bring order, method, or uniformity to; to compare one thing to another in the sense of a rule of measurement, often as a proverb or parable.
An authoritative rule dealing with details or procedure. The power and authority of one to regulate and control over another.
To rule over a kingdom as king or queen.
To refuse an action or thought that is not wanted or is despised.
To be happy, glad.
A state of felicity or happiness.
As shaken off.
To let go by dropping or shaking loose.
A deliverance or freedom from a trouble, burden or danger.
To continue unchanged; to stay behind.
A remaining group, part or trace.
What is left behind, a residue. A relative as a remnant. Flesh as what remains after death.
To recall an event or action in memorial or reflection. To speak on behalf of another.To reenact a past event as a memorial. The hiphil (causative) form means "mention."
A recalling of a past event. Also, an action based on a past event.
A usually small part, member, or trace remaining.
Something that is taken away or thrown out. A menstruating woman that is removed from the camp.
To reveal something by exposing it. Usually to be exposed from the removal of clothing.
That which takes the place of , especially as a substitute or successor. In the sense of passing through one thing to another.
An account or statement of an event or happening. What is heard.
To stir as in stirring the waters or to stir from sleep. In the sense of stirring the eyes.
To produce new individuals of the same kind; to be abundant in fruit.
A seeking for what is not known.
To free or deliver from a trouble, burden or danger.
To be of like kind. Having attributes that are similar in shape, size or value.
To be like, similar or compared to something else. To become silent as one dead.
To dwell permanently or continuously.
One who abides or dwells in a place or area.
A relief from labor, punishment or trouble.
Freedom from activity or labor. To rest from trouble or labor.
A day when work and normal activities are halted.
To prevent from doing. Hold back, in the sense of grabbing the heel.
To confine within bounds. Hold back or prevent someone or something.
Restoring to consciousness or life.
A large land animal where some species have one horn (Latin: unicornis) and others have two (Latin: bicornis).
Any of the paired bony or cartilaginous bones that stiffen the walls of the thorax and protect the organs beneath. A ridge of a hill from its similar shape to a rib. Also, the side.
Having wealth or great possessions; abundantly supplied with resources, means, or funds.
Wealth. The possessions that make one wealthy.
To sit and travel in any conveyance; to sit astride an animal, wagon or chariot.
A direction as in to the right.
The hand on the right side of a person. Also, a direction as in "to the right."
The edge of a region, hole, etc. , in the sense of enclosing.
A circular band of metal or other durable material. Also the signet ring containing the mark of the owner that is sunk into a lump of clay as a seal.
Fruit that has come to full maturity and fit for eating.
To bring to completeness or perfection. Give off the fragrance of the fruit as it ripens. To add spices to a body for embalming.
To assume an upright position; to raise or rise up; to continue or establish.
To lift or grow up high.
A rising of smoke from a burnt offering. Captivity in the sense of placing a yoke on the captives.
The early morning rising of the sun.
A natural stream of water of considerable volume. The life-giving water that washes over the soil.
A route or path for traveled or walked. The path or manner of life.
To wander around restlessly.
To make a loud noise.
A meat that is cooked over a fire.
A long flowing outer garment. Wide garment.
A wall made of rocks or stones for protection.
A long and slender bar of wood. A staff for walking.
A written document that may be wrapped round on itself.
The wheel of a cart or a whirlwind.
The covering of a dwelling place.
Material used for a top or covering of a building. What covers something.
The underground part of a plant. The source or origin of a thing.
A circuitous way or route.
As round.
To gather together a flock, herd or group of people.

1. Cylindrical; something as a circle, globe or ring that is round. A round thing or place. A round loaf of bread. An expanse as a round piece of land. 2. Kikar: A dry standard of measure. Usually rendered as "talent" in most translations, however the word talent is a transliteration of the Greek word talanton (a Greek coin) used in the Greek Septuagint for the Hebrew word "kikar."
Set or placed in a line. A mountain range as a row.
A settlement usually larger than a hamlet and smaller than a town.
To polish a sword by rubbing it. Also the plucking of hair by rubbing it with a sharp object.
Having a healthy reddish color.
A city that is covered over and made into a mound.
To exert control, direction, or influence over, especially by curbing or restraining; to spread out through a land through authority or by walking among the subjects.
To go faster than a walk.
A bag of cloth or skins for carrying foods or objects.
An animal killed for an offering.
An act of offering to deity something precious; to kill an animal for an offering.
A vessel used to hold the required sacrifice. From the shape of a bowl that holds liquids like a breast that holds milk.
A shaped mounted support on which an object can travel; to bind up with a saddle.
One of a pair of covered pouches laid behind the saddle. For carrying items.
The act or the duty of protecting or defending; to watch over or guard in the sense of preserving or protecting. To keep watch.
To keep safe. To protect.
A state or place of safety.
An ingredient that adds flavor to food and used in preserving foods.
A place set apart for a special purpose.

Loose granular material from the disintegration of rocks and consisting of particles not as fine as silt and used in mortar. Sand is used as an abrasive ingredient for drilling by placing it in the hole being drilled.
A shoe consisting of a sole strapped to the foot.
A waistband worn around the waist.
The state of being content.
To speak chains of words that form sentences.
One who speaks words. Possibly a prophet or psalmist.
A sore that spreads.
The covering of a fish. Also the scales of leather armor.
Any of various bright reds.
To fling away heedlessly. To separate and go in various directions.
To sow, cast or fling widely.
A word of uncertain meaning.
To briskly rub something.
To cut something out or make short.
[NOTE: Dictionary entry needs attention]
To plow in the sense of scratching a line in the soil; to engrave on wood or stone by scratching. This word can also mean "to hold in peace" or be silent.
Wasted away physically.
A document or record written on a sheet of papyrus, leather or parchment and rolled up for storage.
To carve or chisel out a figure from wood or stone.
A figurine that is formed and shaped from stone, wood or clay.
A large body of water. Also, the direction of the great sea (the Mediterranean), the west.
A dry standard of measure equal to 1/3 ephah.
A seal used officially to give personal authority to a document. A signature ring or cylinder with the owner's seal that is pressed into clay to show ownership.
To close tightly, often marked with the emblem of the owner that must be broken before opening.
To look thoroughly in an effort to find or discover something.
To intently look for someone or something until the object of the search is found.
A digging up to uncover something hidden.
To season with salt to enhance the flavor.
A special chair of one in eminence. Usually a throne or seat of authority.
An ordinal number.
That which is unknown or hidden.
Solidly fixed in place; to stand firm in the sense of a support. Not subject to change or revision. The hiphil (causative) form means "support."
To take notice; to perceive something or someone; to see visions. The niphal (passive) form means "appear" and the hiphil (causative) form means "show."

The grains or ripened ovules of plants used for sowing. Scattered in the field to produce a crop. The singular word can be used for one or more. Also, the descendants of an individual, either male or female.
A word of uncertain meaning.
One who is able to see with the eyes.
In the degree that. Sense of paying attention.
To look for or search for something or for answers. The niphal (passive) form means "require."
To possess or take by force; grab hold tightly; to refrain or support by grabbing hold.
To take hold of something by force.
Individuals called out for a special purpose.
Used to express determination, insistence, persistence, or willfulness. One's desire.
To give up property to another for money or another valuable compensation.
To cause to go; to direct, order, or request to go.
To send away a person or gift.
To set or keep apart.
A supernatural creature, possibly a winged serpent or a dragon.
A poisonous snake that hisses, creeps and bites.
One who provides a service to another, as a slave, bondservant or hired hand.
To provide a service to another, as a servant or slave or to work at a profession.
Labor provided by a servant or slave.
To move or place someone or something separate from the whole for a special purpose.
To reserve or put aside something in the sense of keeping in the shadow.
To cause to sit down; to lay down.
A recess for filling with a stone or other ornament.
To stay in a dwelling place for the night or for long periods of time; to sit down.
One who stays temporarily. Travels from place to place.
The place of sitting, resting or dwelling, usually temporarily.
A cardinal number.
An ordinal number.
A sequence of events ending with the seventh.
To cut short or small; to harvest in the sense of severing the crop from its stalk; to be impatient in the sense of patience being severed.
To join two pieces of cloth with stitches of thread.
A standard of measure.
The dark figure cast on a surface by a body intercepting the rays from a light source.
An unknown bird.
To tremble in fear or anger.
To physically or mentally tremble in amazement or fear.
To violently shake back and forth to throw something off. To overthrow.
A shaking anger.
Being physically effected by shivering or shaking from a dreadful event.
In the sense of being whithered and dried up.
To feel pain through something dishonorable, improper or ridiculous.
The outline of an individual.
An unknown animal.
A portion that is provided to a group or person to meet their needs.
A piece of stone from obsidian, flint or chert that forms a narrow and sharp edge when flaked off.
A pointed, piercing object.
To hone in the sense of narrowing the blade edge by using a whetstone or hammer. To narrow the eyes in the sense of looking sharply, as in squinting.
To cut off the hair from the face or another part of the body.
The female who is neither the speaker nor the one addressed.
A female ass.
A female goat.
As bound.
To cut or clip wool or hair from something.
Grains grown in fields watered by the flooding of the river. To gather and bind into a sheaf. Also, meaning a flood that gives water to the soil for growing crops.
A mammal related to the goat and domesticated for its milk, flesh and wool.
A walled place of protection.
A broad piece of cloth or metal. As hammered out flat.
An unknown bird.
A chief Hebrew weight standard of measurement.
A broad piece of defensive armor carried on the arm. A protective structure. Wall of protection.
To emit rays of light. Shine brightly. To shine or cause another to shine through one’s actions or words. The piel (intensive) form means "commend."
A large sea-going vessel. As searching through the sea for a distant shore.
The land bordering a body of water. A place covered.
Having little length. A brief distance.
Short in patience.
Capacity for bearing a task or blame. The shoulders as the place where loads are placed.
The part of an object that acts like a shoulder.
A great shout of alarm of war or for rejoicing.
To shout an alarm of war or for great rejoicing.
To cry out loudly in triumph or joy.
Raising of the voice to show authority, anger or gladness.
A flat tray attached to a handle for scooping up hot coals.
To have compassion; to sympathize.
To shrink in fear or timidness.
A low-growing, usually severally stemmed bush or woody plant, as used for making booths.
To close or block an opening.
To stop by halting or closing.
A physical or emotional illness. Weakened.
An area next to something.
Exhaling of breath as in relief. To breath out as a desire for rest.
Sightless; unquestioning, as having no regard to rational discrimination, guidance or restriction. As a shutting of the eyes.
The motion, gesture, or mark representing an agreement between two parties. A wondrous or miraculous sign.
To keep silent by holding the tongue, silent and still.
A state of speechlessness or extreme quiet.
A soft metal capable of a high degree of polish used for coinage, implements and ornaments. A desired and precious metal.
To cook a soup over a fire. To be heated with pride or anger.
From a time in the past until now, in the sense of being on the heel of something else.
A tendon.
To express one's voice in a melody or to music.
A burning of the skin or hair.
As plucked on musical instruments.
To sink down.
To drop down; to be slack or idle due to weakness, illness or laziness. The niphal (passive) form means "lazy."
A female who has the same parents as another or shares one parent with another.
Meaning dubious.
A cardinal number.
An ordinal number.
The ability to decide or discern between good and bad, right and wrong.
A person characterized by a deep understanding of a craft.
A flat surface for preparing foods.
The integument covering men or animals, as well as leather made from animal skins. The husk of a seed.
Used for holding cheese, water or any other liquid.
To move with quick steps in joy.
The bones of the head. The roundness of the head or skull. Also a census by the counting of heads.
The upper atmosphere that constitutes an apparent great vault or arch over the earth. Place of the winds.
A wood or stone tablet or plank. Often used for writing.
Speaking evil of another (usually done quietly).
The act of slaughtering, the meat of the slaughter or one who slaughters. Also an executioner as one who slaughters.
To strike, beat or kill.
To rest in a state of suspended consciousness.
To make an end of something by cutting it off.
The portions dispersed out.
A weapon made of a pouch that is attached to two long cords and used for throwing stones. Also something that hangs like a sling.
To get away through deliverance or escape.
Capable of calmly awaiting an outcome or result.
To strike or push as an attack.
A pressing into a city for conquering it.
Someone or something that is not very large in size, importance, age or significance.
Something that is few or small in size or amount.
The pressing of the olive to extract the oil.
To overspread with oil for medical treatment or as a sign of authority.
Someone or something that has been smeared or annointed with an oil as a medication or a sign of taking an office. An anointed one; a messiah.
The odor or scent of a thing. As carried on the wind. To be "refreshed", as when taking in a deep breath.
To deliver a hit with the intent to harm; to bring a plague in the sense of a striking.
The gaseous products of combustion.
To emit a gaseous cloud when burning.
To burn sluggishly without flame. The smoke of the burning incense or fat.
Having an even, continuous surface. This word can also mean "flattery" in the sense of being slippery.
A word of uncertain meaning.
To make a sudden closing; to break suddenly with a sharp sound; to splinter a piece of wood; to lash out in anger as a splintering.
A trap laid with bait to capture an animal or person. An entrapment.
To cut off the front part (Often used in the context of circumcision).
To take a nap.
A heavy breathing out of anger.
A forcing of the breath violently through the nostrils with a loud, harsh sound.
A precipitation of water in the form of ice crystals.
In a manner or way indicated or suggested. What comes before or after another event.
An affirmation of firmness and support.
To be delicate and pleasurable.
Free from harshness, sternness, or violence. To act softly. A charmer.
To stay as a temporary resident. Travel in a strange land. Also, the extended meaning of "to be afraid" of a stranger.
Separated from the whole of the unit (see Psalm 68:7 [6]).
A male offspring. This can be the son or a later male descendant of the father. One who continues the family line.
The act or art of singing.
Residue left after burning.
To perform supernatural magic.
Deep distress and regret.
One who moves slowly.
To spread seeds on the ground; to plant a crop.
To forbear to destroy, punish, or harm; give asylum. Give refuge to another.
The spark of a fire or thunderbolt. Also an arrow as a flashing thunderbolt.
To ceremonially sprinkle water or oil on something that is being dedicated.
A careful arrangement of words or commands said orally.
Like the bill of bird used to defend the nest.
A person, item, time or place that has the quality of being unique; Separated from the rest for a special purpose.
The spots marking sheep and goats.
The chain of words when speaking.
A wheat like grain with what looks like trimmed hair.
Various aromatic vegetable products used to season or flavor foods.
A mixture of spices for an ointment or perfume.
A sweet smelling spice.
To revolve in a circle without moving forward.
The tree of the body which provides its uprightness.
To eject saliva, usually on another in spite or disrespect.
Someone or something that is exceptional. A wonder.
A prominent beauty or work as shouting out.
The sharp flying objects from a snapped piece of wood. Also wrath as flying splinters.
To divide lengthwise.
The hard covering of a clean animals foot that is divided into two parts.
Plunder taken from an enemy in war or robbery. To impair the quality or effect of.
Something that is seized by violence and robbery; prey; booty.
A word of uncertain meaning.
A small area visibly different from the surrounding area. To be covered with spots.
An animal with white spots which appear as hailstones.
To spread out excessively.
To expand beyond a starting point; to be easily and plainly understood in the sense of being spread out to see.
To lay out in a large area. The piel (intensive) form means "persuade."
A source of water issuing from the ground. As the eye of the ground.
To grow up as a plant.
To drip a liquid, usually water or blood.
A word of uncertain meaning.
A container of liquid that is used to drip the liquid.
To send up or out new growth, as of a plant. Sprout green sprouts.
A word of unknown meaning.
To exert pressure either physically or emotionally.
Pressure being exerted, either physically or emotionally.
A pile of grain or dirt.
A walking stick made from the branch of a tree. Also, a tribe as a branch of the family.
To reel from side to side; to wag or shake back and forth or up and down; to wander as staggering about.
A straight or stepped incline for ascending and descending.
The main stem and support of a plant.
To rise, raise or set in a place.
To be vertical in position; to stand tall and erect; to set in place.
A flag that hangs from a pole with the insignia of a tribe or army. Also, a sail.
A natural luminous body visible in the night sky.
To carefully look; to make a close inspection.
A single declaration or remark.
To stand firm and in place.
A word of uncertain meaning.
A staff made from a sapling or branch. A support for walking.
To remain behind; to wait in anticipation.
To remain or stay through the night.
The following of the established path or course of action.
One that makes or sets right. Conforming to fact, standard or truth.
Conformity to fact, standard or truth.
To wrongfully take the property of another; rob.
An elongated depression between uplands, hills, or mountains.
The distance between the feet of a step.
To take a step. A journey as a treading. The stringing of a bow is a treading as the foot is stepped over the bow and using the leg to bend it.
Failing to produce or incapable of producing offspring, fruit or spores. Being without children in the sense of being plucked of fruit.
Fish or meat cooked with vegetables. To become agitated or worried.
A branch or staff as separated from the tree. Linen cloth, from its stiff and divided fibers. Often used in the idiom "to his/her own stick" meaning alone or self.
To emit a bad odor or be loathsome.
To disturb the quiet of; agitate.
To shake to awaken.
As a cavity.
A piece of rock, often in the context of building material.
To gather stones for stoning. The act of throwing rocks with the intention of killing. To remove stones from a road or field.
A platform made of stone and used by a potter or a midwife.
A seat or throne.
To bend the body forward and downward while bending the knees; to stoop or crouch down by bending or getting on the knees.
To cause to cease; to stop from occurring in the sense of halting, shutting or restraining.
To store up something in a safe place as if bound up.
Places for storing foods or other items for future benefit.
To be afraid as from a storm.
Without a bend, angle, or curve. A straight line, path or thought. The cord of the bow as stretched taught.
A loud wind instrument.
A narrow tight place or situation.
A foreigner that permanently or temporarily resides with a native. A person or thing unknown or with whom one is unacquainted.
Knowledge, information or example imparted to provide guidance, correction and discipline.

Stalks of grain after threshing; dry, stalky plant residue. When more permanent structures were built, they were constructed of stones and bricks made of clay and straw; replacing the tent panels as the main component of construction for dwellings.
A body of running water; any body of flowing water.
A thoroughfare, especially in a city, town or village.
The quality or state of being strong.
Something that causes oppression.
To lie or stretch out as to rest; to crouch down to hide for an ambush.
The act of being hit. A plague as hitting the people.
A cord or rope, as straight. Also a straight line, path or thought.
To remove clothing, covering, or surface matter from. As peeled.
Having stripes or streaks. As appearing to be whipped with a cord.
Marks made by ropes binding the wrist or lashes with a rope.
A ground of dispute or complaint. A clash between sides.
Having or marked by great physical strength.
The act of trying to achieve the goal, but with hindrances.
What is left after the stalk has been removed.
As stiff.
Used to cause someone to stumble or topple down.
To conquer and bring into subjection; bring under control. Place the foot on the land in the sense of subduing it. Also, to place one’s foot into another nation in the sense of subduing it.
A word of uncertain meaning.
To hide by burying or to cover.
Become quiet or less. To calm down or set down.
A fundamental or characteristic part or quality. Any standing thing or person.
Difficult to understand or distinguish. In craftiness or prudence.
Performance that calls no attention to its self. To act in craftiness or prudence.
To give milk to from the breast or udder. The hiphil (causative) form means "nurse (verb)."
As a wink of time.
An amount that is not lacking. What is enough.
The total amount. An amount weighed out.
The season between spring and autumn.
The head, top or beginning of a place, such as a river or mountain, or a time, such as an event. The point at which something starts; origin, source.
The luminous body around which the earth revolves and from which it receives heat and light.
An object of worship representing the sun god.
When the first light of the sun comes over the horizon. An eastward direction as the place of the rising sun.
A place where grain or other items of subsistence are held and protected.
To uphold or defend; to hold up or serve as a foundation or prop for.
To cause to be brought low by force, hindered.
Safe from danger or harm; marked by or given to feelings of confident certainty. What is firm.
In a sure manner. To be firm in something.
To be surrounded, encompassed, by a wall of stone or thorns for protection.
What is left behind.
To provide what is needed to make someone or something whole or complete.
To pass through the mouth and move into the esophagus to the stomach.
To move, as a large mass of creatures.
The creature(s) of a large swarm.
A six legged insect having short antennae and commonly migrating in swarms that strip the vegetation from large areas.
To completely submit to a promise or oath with words and spoken seven times.
The act of taking an oath.
To excrete moisture in visible quantities through the pores of the skin.
The sweeping away of something.
Pleasing to the taste. Not sour, bitter or salty. Something that smells pleasing.
An aromatic spice that is pleasing to the nose.
A weapon with a long blade for cutting or thrusting.
A flat surface, usually made of wood and with four legs, for laying out the meal to be eaten.
An unknown species of animal.
An unknown bird.
The hindmost flexible appendage of an animal.
To receive what is given; to gain possession by seizing.
To separate out one equal portion out of five.
To beat or shatter into pieces; to fear or be in terror in the sense of being shattered.
To receive an object in exchange for a promise.
To scrape off or clip. To impair or degrade.
To be silent.
To have possession or ownership of; to keep in restraint; to have or maintain in one's grasp; to grab something and keep hold of it.
The placing of a yoke on the shoulders to perform work or undertake a task.
A traveler selling stories and songs. As a talebearer.
To deliver or express in spoken words.
The tree or a grove of desert shrubs and trees with masses of minute flowers..
A shallow, one-headed drum with loose disks at the sides played by shaking, striking with the hand, or rubbing with the thumb.
A dark and thick liquid that floats to the surface of water and is used as a waterproof covering for boats.
A forced labor or service.
Something that is made from twisted fibers.
To have a pleasant taste to the mouth.
Having a marked and pleasing flavor. As a pleasurable thing.
Acquired knowledge or skills that mark the direction one is to take in life. A straight direction. Knowledge passed from one person to another.
To rip into pieces.
To tear into pieces as a predator does to its prey; to rip a cloth into pieces.
To remove reluctantly.
A cardinal number.
Having a soft or yielding texture; easily broken, cut, or damaged. From the tenderness of the loins.
The black, goat hair dwelling of the nomad.
A wall of fabric or hung from the roof to make a dividing of a room.
An instrument used to secure the corners and sides of the tent to the ground.
The goat hair curtain that forms the walls of the tent.
An ordinal number.
That which occupies the tenth position in a sequence.
One portion of a whole divided into ten equal portions.
An unknown animal.
To stop or refrain from continuing an action.
A state of intense fear.
A critical examination, observation, or evaluation; trial.
An expression of gratitude or acknowledgement toward another. In the sense of raising up the hands.
An expression of thanks through shouting.
The person, thing, or idea indicated, mentioned, or understood from the situation. A close watching.
Being the person, thing, or idea specified, mentioned, or understood.
The unlawful taking of another's property.
An inquiry of a time or place.
Used to identify another place.
Something that exists.
The persons, things, or ideas present or near in place, time, or thought or just mentioned. A grammatical tool used to identify something specific in the sense of looking toward a sight.
The plural of "she."
The plural of "he."
Heavily compacted material, such as a cloud, forest or thicket, and is filled with darkness.
A rope or other woven object that is tightly wrapped.
A heavy darkness that can be felt.
A heavy darkness that brings about sadness or depression.
One who steals the property of another.
The upper part of the leg of a man or animal. Also a street.
Not dense in distribution; not well-fleshed.
Dough that has been spread thin before baked.
A composition that has been recorded by the written words.
To plan or design a course of action, item or invention.
An ordinal number.
The third increment within the sequence.
The lack of sufficient water.
To lack sufficient water.
A thirsty land.
A person, thing, or idea present or near in place, time, or thought or just mentioned. As prominent or pointed out.
The one nearer or more immediately under observation or discussion.
A prickly plant used by the shepherd to build a corral around the flock at night.
A plant, bush or tree, that grows thorns.
However; nevertheless. In spite of the fact of. A possible or desired location. To bring attention to an event.
The forming of ideas in the mind.
Ten times one hundred in amount or number.
A filament of fibers twisted together by spinning and used for sewing or tying items together.
A cardinal number.
Literally the day before yesterday, but used as an idiom for the past.

To propel through the air by a forward motion; to drizzle as a throwing down of water; to teach in the sense of throwing or pointing a finger in a straight line as the direction one is to walk. The hiphil (causative) form means "teach."
To lead astray; to deliver to an enemy by treachery; to reveal unintentionally.
To remove from a place, usually in a sudden or unexpected manner; to cast out, down or away.
To throw stones for execution.
To stretch out the hand to grab; to show praise or confession.
To push or drive with force a pole into the ground, such as when setting up the tent; to blow the trumpet in the sense of throwing out the sound.
The opposable digit of the hand. Also the big toe of the foot. Perceived as the builder because of its unique abilities.
To fasten, attach, or close by means of a string or cord; to tie around; to conspire in the sense of tying up.
To attach or bind one object to another by tying them together.
To wrap or fasten with a cord.
The measured or measurable period during which an action, process or condition exists or continues. A counting or reckoning of time.
A period of sadness or mourning.
A metal separated out by smelting.
An unknown animal.
The pointed end of an object.
Drained of strength and energy; fatigued.
A word given to an individual or place denoting its character. The character of an individual or place.
Used as a function word to indicate movement or an action or condition suggestive of progress toward a place, person, or thing reached.
A Southern direction, which is to the right when facing the rising sun.
A precise moment in time or a specific location.
In or into one place, mass, collection, or group.
To work hard and long.
Something given as a promise as an exchange.
The next day. At a time following.
An instrument used for grasping, having two arms working together. A tool for taking coals out of the fire.
A fleshy moveable process on the floor of the mouth used in speaking and eating. Also, language as a tongue.
Hard bony appendages on the jaws used for chewing food and forming of sounds when talking.
The crown of the head.
Possibly the Topaz, which may be yellow, gray, white, pink, green or blue in color. Other possible translations are Beryl, Lapis Lazuli, Amber, Jasper, Serpentine, Olivine, or Flint.
To fall over in death or from being pushed.
A burning stick of resinous wood. Also, lightning as a torch in the night sky.
Pulled apart. Flesh that is torn.
To heave or fling about; to throw with a quick, light, or careless motion; to be thrown about or wander around as nodding the head.
To look deeply.
To waver as a green branch.
To lay hands upon; to touch or strike; to be touched by a plague.
To travel an area from border to border.
A structure higher than its diameter and high relative to its surroundings. Place of great size.
A small village.

The business of buying and selling or bartering commodities. To go about as a merchant trading goods. In Psalm 38:11 this word is used for the beating of the heart in the sense of going about to and fro.
To purposely destroy by stomping upon to break or smash.
A state of partly suspended animation or inability to function. A deep sleep or unconsciousness.
A state of rest.
To commit an unintentional or treacherous act that results in error.
An unintentional or treacherous act that results in error.
To forcefully take or seize.
Articles of dress or adornment that often witness to a person's position or rank.
To trample under foot.
To be on foot walking through a foreign land, usually in the sense of spying; to trample another with the tongue.
A creature that crawls or creeps on something.
Wealth hoarded up or stored. What is hidden.
A woody perennial plant with a supporting stem or trunk and multiple branches. Meaning "wood" when written in the plural form.
To shake involuntarily; shiver.
An involuntary shaking or shivering out of fear or awe.
A physical reaction, such as shivering, in fear or dread.
The act of trying, testing, or putting to the proof.
A social group consisting of numerous families, clans or generations together. A family lineage as bound together.
As a division of the waters. Split into two.
An assessment based on a number.
To set aside a time for a special occasion.
A difficulty that brings about weariness.
A long, shallow often V-shaped receptacle for the drinking water or food of domestic animals.
An instrument of flowing air to make a sound. Also, the horn of a ram as used as a trumpet.
The state of being the case. Fact. What is firm. Accurately so.
A container with a lip. The lip of the door.
A simple slip-on garment with or without sleeves.
A cloth that is wrapped around the head.
To rotate or revolve; to face another direction; to turn the face; to turn directions; to turn something back or away.
To change the location, position, station, or residence; to remove. The hiphil (causative) form means "remove."
To deviate from the correct path toward another direction.
To return to a previous place or state.
To turn aside in fainting or hiding.
A change in location, position, station or residence, usually as a revolt.

Possibly the Turquoise, a blue to green stone that was commonly mined in the Near East. The Septuagint has Anthrax meaning coal. Other possible translations are Carbuncle, Garnet, Emerald and Malachite.
A small wild pigeon.
A secondary shoot or stem arising from a main trunk or axis..
The light from the sky between full night and sunrise; or between sunset and full night.
Born with one other or as a pair at birth.
To toss back and forth.
A winding or wrapping together; entwined in pain or joy.
A path that winds back on itself. To twist words or actions away from their proper context.
To wrap separate pieces together forming one unit.
Gross injustice; wickedness. The result of twisted actions.
A cardinal number.
A word of uncertain meaning.
A flowing lesion.
Without design, attention, preparation, or premeditation.
A male with a foreskin.
What is morally or physically impure; dirty, filthy.
To remove the covering.
Beneath. Below or underneath. Also, to be underneath in the sense of being in place of something else.
Garment worn under another garment that is bundled up.
To grasp the meaning of; to have comprehension.
A comprehension of the construction of a structure or thought.
The place of the dead.
Empty. As an empty box that needs to be filled.
A place cut off.
Someone or something that has, or has been given the quality of specialness, and has been separated from the rest for a special purpose.
A unit within the whole, a unified group. A single quantity.
To put together to form a single unit.
A hard and flat bread or cake made without yeast.
Except on the condition that.
An action that lacks any results.
The conclusion of a determinate period of time. Also, again; a repetition of time, either definite or indefinite; another time; once more.
To give support or to steady.
To be on or over in the sense of the yoke that is placed on the neck of the ox.
Higher than the others.
As the leg of a stream.
Violence in defiance of something. Something that is lifted up such as a burden, gift or flame.
In a direction from lower to higher.
The lending or practice of lending money at an exorbitant interest.
Words spoken out of rashness.
Possessing or acting with bravery or boldness. The mighty power of a bird in flight. Anything or anyone of great mental or physical strength.
An elongated depression between ranges of hills or mountains. As deep. Obscure, in the sense of dark.
The state of being empty of contents or usefulness.
A wheeled transport such as a wagon or chariot used for transportation. Also, the top millstone as a wheel that rides on top of the lower millstone.
To cover, provide, obscure, or conceal with or as if with a cloth.
The desire for revenge.
The poison of serpents that comes sacks located in the head. Also by extension any type of poison.
A floating container for holding items. Used for the basket that carried Mosheh down the Nile river and the boat made by Noah.
Active bodily or mental strength or force. The power within the belly or loins for reproduction or creative work.
A town or village without walls of protection.
From where grapes are plucked.
Made by souring grapes.
A planting of grapevines.
The gathered crop of grapes.
Exertion of physical force so as to injure or abuse. A violent shaking.
An unmarried young woman who is absolutely chaste.
Something seen in a dream, trance, or ecstasy.
To see or form a mental image of; to dream dreams.
The faculty of utterance. Sound of a person, musical instrument, the wind, thunder, etc.
To promise solemnly.
The bed or valley of a stream. A choice piece of land desired in an inheritance because of its fertility.
Small thinly baked bread.
The reward or price paid for one's labor.
What is brought to a harlot as a gift.
A walled wagon for transport. From its shell as a wagon.
The slender part of the body above the hips.
To move along on foot; walk a journey; to go. Also, customs as a lifestyle that is walked or lived.

A permanent upright construction having a length much greater than the thickness and presenting a continuous surface, may be constructed of a curtain, earth, rocks or hewed stones. Used for shelter, protection, or privacy, or to subdivide interior space.
To go astray due to deception or an outside influence. To staggar, as from being intoxicated.
To urge or advise to be careful. To caution.
A tool used for weaving, an activity performed while sitting down.
One of great strength in battle, such as a warrior. One who is strong in authority, such as a master.
To immerse articles of clothing into a cleaning solution and agitate them, usually by treading upon them, to clean them; to clean the body.
A dry or desolate place. Barren or uncultivated land. Also a dry land.
A place for watching.
The Liquid of streams, ponds and seas or stored in cisterns or jars. The necessary liquid that is drank.
A flowing body of water.
A trench for bringing water into the village. A place for domestic animals to quench thirst.
To move an object, such as hammer or a sacrifice, back and forth.
To go about in a shaking motion.
The action of moving an object, such as hammer or a sacrifice, back and forth.
I and the rest of a group.
One who dangles the head in poverty or hunger.
To reduce in strength.
To cover with cloth or clothing; to provide with clothing; put on clothing. The hiphil (causative) form means "clothe."
To make useless, especially by long or hard usage.
To interlace (threads, yarns, strips, fibrous material, etc.) so as to form a fabric or material.
A period of time consisting of seven days or seven years.
To express deep sorrow, especially by shedding tears.
The act of expressing sorrow by shedding tears.
To ascertain the heaviness of by a balance or scale. Weigh out, usually of silver for payment.
The amount a thing weighs. Relative heaviness.
A dug-out hole, usually a well or cistern.
Interrogative expressing inquiry about the identity, nature, or value of an object. Something that is unknown; can also be why, when or how.
A cereal grain that yields a fine white flour, the chief ingredient of bread.
A circular frame or disk arranged to revolve on an axis, as on a wagon or chariot.
Usually a young lion.
At, in, or to what place.
A person, thing, or idea present or near in place, time, or thought or just mentioned.
Anywhere at all. A search for a person, place or time.
To sharpen a knife or other cutting edge with a stone.
Or who, what or that. This word links the action of the sentence to the one doing the action.
To strike, in punishment or anger with a rope or cord.
A circling wind that devours what is on the land in its mouth.
Free from color.
A light colored blemish or spot on the skin and a possible sign of leprosy.
What or which person or persons. Someone that is unknown.
Free of wound or injury; free of defect or impairment; having all its proper parts or components.
As paid with food.
For what cause, purpose or reason for which.
A receptacle made of interwoven materials such as reeds.
Having great extent or breadth.
To increase the size of an area wide; large; roomy.
A woman who has lost her husband by death. As bound in grief.
The quality of being a widow. As bound in grief.
Largeness of extent or scope. From the width of a road.
A wild animal as prolific.
A tract or region uncultivated and uninhabited by human beings. Place of order, a sanctuary.
To give honor or offering out of one's own free will.
A natural movement of air; breath. The breath of man, animal or God. The character. A space in between.
A hole in the wall that admits light and a view of the other side.
Fermented juice of fresh grapes. From the mire in the wine.

A leather bag that holds wine and is hung from the pole of the tent. Can also mean "medium" as one who evokes the dead, a ghost, possibly from their mumbling like the sound of wine poured out of the wineskin.
An appendage that allows an animal, bird or insect to fly. Also, the wings of a garment.
The season between summer and spring. Time of the piercing cold and relative bleakness.
To remove by drying or sweeping away through rubbing; to polish in the sense of a vigorous rubbing; erase.
A slender, string-like piece or filament of relatively rigid or flexible metal often used for snares.
Through the idea of being together in a group.
To take back or withhold what is cherished; to turn away or move back.
To become dry and sapless; to shrivel.
To hold back from action.
In the sense of being close or in the interior of. An approaching.
A lacking of something or the inability to do or have something. The search for a place of unknown origin.
An exception in the sense of shaking everything out except one.
Attestation of a fact or event. An object, person or group that affords evidence.
A yellowish colored animal.
An adult female person. As mortal.
An organ where something is generated or grows before birth.
An amazing sight or event that causes one to be dismayed. Something out of the ordinary.
Round wooden dowels.
An arrangement of words, ideas or concepts to form sentences. A promise in the sense of being “ones word.” An action in the sense of acting out an arrangement. A plague as an act. A matter or thing.
Activity where one exerts strength or faculties to do or perform something. An action.
To carefully and thoroughly perform a task such as gleaning a field. Also, to mock or abuse in the sense of walking over another.
A word of uncertain meaning.
What is done or performed.
The number assigned according to its amount, importance or need.
A god or being without power.
In the sense of joining. A yearning for certain direction or action.
An injury involving rupture of small blood vessels and discoloration without a skin break. The dark coloring of the skin caused by being hit or smashed.
A container made from multiple pieces of material entwined together into one unit.
Material made from weaving threads of fibers together to become a solid piece.
To envelop and secure for transport or storage. Also, meaning to faint.
To enclose; to repeat or do again what has been said or done. The hiphil (causative) form means "warn."
Strong vengeful anger. As crossing over from peace.
As encircling the head. Used as a sign of authority like a crown.
To contend by grappling with to throw one's opponent off balance.
To wring the neck.
The joint between the hand and arm. Also, a garment with sleeves that reaches to the wrist.
To inscribe a story, thoughts or instructions on in a variety of mediums including stone, papyrus, leather or parchment.
An unknown bird.
An unknown animal, probably from its dark color.
An unknown bird.
Fibers that are spun together to form one strand.
The period of around 365 solar days.
To long persistently, wistfully, or sadly. What is desired, whether good or bad.
To have an earnest or strong desire; long.
To long persistently, wistfully, or sadly. What is desired, whether good or bad.
A vehement protest; a loud cry.
To call out in a louder than normal voice; to declare; to cry out for help.
On the day last past. Idiomatic for a time past.
A repeating of something.
To produce or be productive.
A wooden bar or frame by which two draft animals are joined at the heads or necks for working together.
Pronoun, second person, feminine plural.
Pronoun, second person, feminine singular
Pronoun, second person, masculine plural.
Pronoun, second person, masculine singular.
A person of short life.
A word of uncertain meaning.
A young camel.
A young female of marriageable age or newly married as at the prime age for work.
A male that has moved from youth to young adulthood.
A young featherless bird as plucked.
A young one of the flock.
A female that has moved from youth to young adulthood.
A young age.
Young acting no matter the age.
Someone who is insistent on reaching the desired outcome. Single minded. One who is protective over someone or something.
A protective or suspicious nature.
An unknown species of animal.
